original: gzhan gyi zhes khongs su 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes khongs su 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase not in any other way means that it is not refuted in any other way.

original: me yang yin la sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes de ltar rtogs pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me yang yin la sreg par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes de ltar rtogs pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For there is no one who thinks, Fire is, but it does not burn.

original: de lta ma yin pa la zhes bya ba ni phyi rol ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa la zhes bya ba ni phyi rol ma yin pa la'o //
translated: The phrase if it were not so means if it were not external.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du'o //
translated: The phrase in that way means externally.

original: pha rol gyi 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ces smras so //
analyzed: pha rol gyi 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ces smras so //
translated: He says, in the conventions of the everyday world.

original: gal te 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la mi ltos na de'i tshe don bya ba med pas ji ltar mi bde bar 'gyur zhes mnos pa'o //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la mi ltos na de'i tshe don bya ba med pas ji ltar mi bde bar 'gyur zhes mnos pa'o //
translated: If one does not rely on the conventions of the everyday world, then, since there would be no object of activity, how could there be unhappiness?

original: don nyid kyang zhes ba ni myong ba ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: don nyid kyang zhes ba ni myong ba ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The phrase even the object itself means that experience must be accepted without doubt,

original: de ltar ma yin na don yang khas blang bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na don yang khas blang bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it were not so, it would not be tenable to accept the object.

original: myong ba'i dngos po khas len na yang thams cad rang rig pa nyid yin te gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myong ba'i dngos po khas len na yang thams cad rang rig pa nyid yin te gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if one accepts the reality of experience, it is all self-awareness, because anything else is untenable.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni mun khung na'o //üîΩ'di la brjod pa ni tshogs pa gcig pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni mun khung na'o // 'di la brjod pa ni tshogs pa gcig pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means in the darkness.

original: de lta na ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta na ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIt is not so.‚Äù

original: mun pa'i gnas skabs na bum pa gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mun pa'i gnas skabs na bum pa gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the pot exists in the darkness.

original: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni mar me'i dkyil 'khor tshogs pa kho na rgyu yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni mar me'i dkyil 'khor tshogs pa kho na rgyu yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the collection of the circle of the lamp is the cause,

original: 'di la brjod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the response to that is ‚ÄúIt is not so.‚Äù

original: sngon po la sogs pa ni ser po la sogs pa ltos pa nyid 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ni ser po la sogs pa ltos pa nyid 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Blue and so on are not apprehended in dependence on yellow and so on,

original: 'ba' zhig kyang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig kyang 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are apprehended alone.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor yang mar me med par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor yang mar me med par 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the circle would be apprehended without the lamp.

original: gzhan gyis de ltar na zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis de ltar na zhes smras so //
translated: Another says, ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù

original: re zhig gang gi tshe sngon po dang ser po dag dus gcig nyid du gzung ba de'i tshe gnyis ka'i byed pa brtag par bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang mar me'i dkyil 'khor gnyis ka'i byed pa brtag par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: re zhig gang gi tshe sngon po dang ser po dag dus gcig nyid du gzung ba de'i tshe gnyis ka'i byed pa brtag par bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang mar me'i dkyil 'khor gnyis ka'i byed pa brtag par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: When blue and yellow are apprehended at the same time, the function of both is to be examined. In the same way, here, the function of both circles of light is to be examined.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni mar me tsam gyis bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni mar me tsam gyis bya ba'o //
translated: The reply to this is: The function is by the mere lamp.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni dkyil 'khor nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni dkyil 'khor nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù is the circle itself.

original: de lta na yang shes pa'i tshogs pa bskyed pas ni de ni shes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang shes pa'i tshogs pa bskyed pas ni de ni shes pa kho na'o //
translated: Even so, since it produces a collection of consciousnesses, it is consciousness itself.

original: mig dang gzugs nyid du mngon par 'dod pa de las ma gtogs pa'i shes pa ni med do //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs nyid du mngon par 'dod pa de las ma gtogs pa'i shes pa ni med do //
translated: There is no consciousness apart from what is accepted as the eye and form.

original: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa ni 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The establishment of the text is ‚ÄúNevertheless.‚Äù

original: bzlog pa brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa brjod pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reversal is stated in ‚ÄúThis is not so.‚Äù

original: gsal ba dang @306b mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin dang 'brel pa ni mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba dang @306b mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin dang 'brel pa ni mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: The connection with the nature of the manifest and the unmanifest is also seen.

original: 'on te phyi rol snang yang tha dad par 'gyur bas 'di la ci byar yod snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te phyi rol snang yang tha dad par 'gyur bas 'di la ci byar yod snyam na /
translated: But if it appears externally, it would be different. What can be done about this?

original: nges pa dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIt has the nature of certainty.‚Äù

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba phyi rol gyi rang bzhin tha dad par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba phyi rol gyi rang bzhin tha dad par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the consequence that the nature of the external would be different.

original: mtshan nyid ni de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is its characteristic.

original: zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBecause it has the nature of appearance.‚Äù

original: don tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur mod ci nyes snyam na /
analyzed: don tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur mod ci nyes snyam na /
translated: If it is objected that it would follow that the object would be different,

original: don tha dad pa yin na yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don tha dad pa yin na yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúEven if the object is different.‚Äù

original: gsal de rang nyid kyi rang bzhin du zhes bya ba mi gsal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gsal de rang nyid kyi rang bzhin du zhes bya ba mi gsal ba yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIs the clear nature of the object not the nature of the object itself?‚Äù

original: brjod pa ji ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brjod pa ji ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù

original: de ltar gsal ba'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar gsal ba'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be the nature of the clear object?

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dag ni tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dag ni tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the clear and the unclear are different.

original: de'i ngo bor zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba yang gsal ba de'i ngo bor rtogs pa'i phyir de zhes bya ba de'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa de gsal ba dang mi gsal ba de rang bzhin tha dad pa las ji ltar bden par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bor zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba yang gsal ba de'i ngo bor rtogs pa'i phyir de zhes bya ba de'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa de gsal ba dang mi gsal ba de rang bzhin tha dad pa las ji ltar bden par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the nature of that‚Äù means that the unclear is understood to be in the nature of the clear. ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means that it is understood to be of the nature of that. How could that clear and unclear be truly different in nature?

original: 'on kyang 'khrul pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khrul pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: But it would be only a mistake.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dag med par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dag med par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: This is what is being said: the clear and unclear would be understood to be nonexistent.

original: rtogs pa nyid tha dad par 'gyur te don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa nyid tha dad par 'gyur te don ni ma yin no //
translated: The understanding itself would be different, not the object.

original: 'on te rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa dag la tha dad pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa dag la tha dad pa med do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the clear and unclear are not different,

original: bshad pa gzung ba'i rang bzhin tha mi dad pa yin na'o //
analyzed: bshad pa gzung ba'i rang bzhin tha mi dad pa yin na'o //
translated: we reply: the nature of the object is not different.

original: mthong ba'i bye brag ni shes pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: mthong ba'i bye brag ni shes pa'i bye brag go //
translated: The difference in seeing is the difference in cognition.

original: ci don gyi rang bzhin snang ba yin nam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de gnyis las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci don gyi rang bzhin snang ba yin nam 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de gnyis las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not go beyond the two alternatives: does the nature of the object appear or not?

original: de zhes bya ba snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba snang ba bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the appearance.

original: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúDistinct‚Äù means that it has a nature that is both manifest and unmanifest.

original: de dang bral bar zhes bya ba ni yan lag phra mo dang bral bar zin pa'o //
analyzed: de dang bral bar zhes bya ba ni yan lag phra mo dang bral bar zin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from that‚Äù means that it is grasped as free from subtle parts.

original: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba dang bcas par 'dzin pa na ni /
analyzed: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba dang bcas par 'dzin pa na ni /
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that if it is grasped as having parts,

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba yongs su gsal ba'i rnam par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba yongs su gsal ba'i rnam par gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúotherwise‚Äù means that it becomes a form that is completely manifest.

original: gang gi tshe sngon po med par gzung ba de'i tshe ci sngon po de mi gsal ba zhes bya bar brjod dam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngon po med par gzung ba de'i tshe ci sngon po de mi gsal ba zhes bya bar brjod dam /
translated: When blue is grasped without yellow, at that time, is the blue described as unmanifest?

original: des na yan lag phra mo gzhan ma bzung yang yan lag can de'i rang bzhin ni 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na yan lag phra mo gzhan ma bzung yang yan lag can de'i rang bzhin ni 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, even though another subtle part is not grasped, the nature of the possessor of the parts is still grasped.

original: des na gsal ba kho nar 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gsal ba kho nar 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it becomes a manifest object that is grasped.

original: du ma nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin yin na'o //
analyzed: du ma nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is manifold‚Äù means that it has the nature of atoms.

original: yan lag phra mo gzung ba de dag las gzhan pa'i yan lag mi 'dzin pa'i phyir mi gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag phra mo gzung ba de dag las gzhan pa'i yan lag mi 'dzin pa'i phyir mi gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: because it would not apprehend the other parts that are different from those parts that are apprehended.

original: gal te rang bzhin @307a * //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin @307a * //
translated: If it is by nature,

original: yin na de'i tshe de las gzhan pa ma zhugs mod de lta na yang de'i rang bzhin ni de nyid de /
analyzed: yin na de'i tshe de las gzhan pa ma zhugs mod de lta na yang de'i rang bzhin ni de nyid de /
translated: then even though it does not enter into what is different from it, it is still its nature.

original: de gsal ba yin pas ji ltar mi gsal ba yin //
analyzed: de gsal ba yin pas ji ltar mi gsal ba yin //
translated: Since it is clear, how can it be unclear?

original: ser po la sogs pa gzung ba na /
analyzed: ser po la sogs pa gzung ba na /
translated: When yellow, etc. is apprehended,

original: sngon po bzhin du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po bzhin du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: it does not become like blue.

original: 'on te phyi don de las yongs su mi gsal ba nyid de skye ba yin na 'di la brjod pa ni 'o na ni zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te phyi don de las yongs su mi gsal ba nyid de skye ba yin na 'di la brjod pa ni 'o na ni zhes pa'o //
translated: But if the external object is produced as unclear from that, the response is:

original: yongs su mi gsal bar snang ba de gzhan gyis ma mthong na ni mi gsal bar rtogs pa nyid yin te don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yongs su mi gsal bar snang ba de gzhan gyis ma mthong na ni mi gsal bar rtogs pa nyid yin te don ni ma yin te /
translated: If the appearance is unclear because it is not seen by another, then it is just the cognition that is unclear, not the object.

original: dung yul gnas pas mi shes te /
analyzed: dung yul gnas pas mi shes te /
translated: The object that exists in the place of the conch is not known

original: rang bzhin shes pa nyid ces bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin shes pa nyid ces bya ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: by the one who knows the nature of the conch.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyang de kho na ltar yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyang de kho na ltar yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya'o //
translated: The expression in this way indicates that the conventional usage of the world is just like that.

original: nye bar btags pa nyid brjod pa ni mi gsal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa nyid brjod pa ni mi gsal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression merely imputed indicates that it is unreal.

original: mi gsal ba dang ldan pa mthong ba gang yin pa de dang 'brel pa las te /
analyzed: mi gsal ba dang ldan pa mthong ba gang yin pa de dang 'brel pa las te /
translated: The expression that which is seen as associated with the unreal indicates that it is associated with that.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa las so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa las so //
translated: The expression from the connection indicates that it is from the connection with the effect of the cause.

original: mthong ba la zhes bya ba shes pa la ni gang gis de yang mi gsal ba zhes brjod par bya ba mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba la zhes bya ba shes pa la ni gang gis de yang mi gsal ba zhes brjod par bya ba mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The expression in the seeing indicates that it is in the cognition, and that the other effect of the unreal, which is the characteristic of the unreal, does not exist.

original: 'on te mi gsal ba'i don dang 'brel pa las so zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te mi gsal ba'i don dang 'brel pa las so zhes brjod na /
translated: If it is said that it is from the connection with the unreal object,

original: 'di la brjod pa'i don ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa'i don ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the meaning of the expression is as follows.

original: don ni mthong ba de'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: don ni mthong ba de'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: The object is not the effect of that seeing.

original: 'on te yang gal te mi gsal ba'i don 'bras bu ma yin mod de lta na yang re zhig 'brel pa tsam zhig ni yod pa yin pas de nyid las mthong ba 'di la mi gsal bar brjod do snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te yang gal te mi gsal ba'i don 'bras bu ma yin mod de lta na yang re zhig 'brel pa tsam zhig ni yod pa yin pas de nyid las mthong ba 'di la mi gsal bar brjod do snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the meaning of unclear is not the effect, but rather that there is just a mere connection, and that is why it is said that this seeing is unclear,

original: gal te mthong ba la mi gsal ba'o zhes de bzhin du brjod pa ni 'brel pa las yin na /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba la mi gsal ba'o zhes de bzhin du brjod pa ni 'brel pa las yin na /
translated: then if it is said that the seeing is unclear because of a connection,

original: de'i tshe mthong ba de la sngon po la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe mthong ba de la sngon po la sogs pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: then at that time, blue and so on would also be said to be seen.

original: de ste brjod do zhe na nga'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ste brjod do zhe na nga'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if you say that they are said to be seen, then the master says, ‚Äúmy!‚Äù

original: de'i phyir mthong ba mi gsal ba kho na yin gyi nye bar brtags pas tha snyad 'dir 'gyur ba ni yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba mi gsal ba kho na yin gyi nye bar brtags pas tha snyad 'dir 'gyur ba ni yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is just the seeing that is unclear, and the conventional expression is made by imputation.

original: 'on te blo mi gsal ba zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ni 'khrul pa kho na yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te blo mi gsal ba zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ni 'khrul pa kho na yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the conventional expression ‚Äúunclear awareness‚Äù is just a mistake,

original: rgyu med par ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu med par ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the master says, ‚Äúwithout a cause.‚Äù

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa nyid du'o //üîΩskabs nyid nye bar sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa nyid du'o //üîΩskabs nyid nye bar sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that it is just a mistake.üîΩThe master concludes, ‚ÄúTherefore...‚Äù

original: blo'i rang bzhin 'di nyid tha dad pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni blo'i rang bzhin nyid rang gi ngo bo'i rnam pa tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blo'i rang bzhin 'di nyid tha dad pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni blo'i rang bzhin nyid rang gi ngo bo'i rnam pa tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature of cognition is not different. The nature of cognition itself is not different in the form of its own essence.

original: rnam pa 'di zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'o //
translated: This aspect is unclear.

original: go dha dang ri bong gi tshul zhes bya @307b ba ni ji ltar ri bong lus che ba de bzhin du go dha'i mjug ma yang ngo //
analyzed: go dha dang ri bong gi tshul zhes bya @307b ba ni ji ltar ri bong lus che ba de bzhin du go dha'i mjug ma yang ngo //
translated: The mode of the hare and the tortoise is like this: just as the body of the tortoise is large, so too is the tail of the hare.

original: shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi sna la sogs par ro //
analyzed: shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi sna la sogs par ro //
translated: It becomes very clear, in one's own nose and so on.

original: don gzhan yin la sgrib pa yang gzhan yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan yin la sgrib pa yang gzhan yin te /
translated: The object is one thing, and the obstruction is another.

original: des skyes zin pa'i don de dag gi snang ba gcad pa des na mthong ngo zhes sems rtsod pa 'di la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bar ti kas btab pa'i lan gang yin pa de brjod pa ni de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: des skyes zin pa'i don de dag gi snang ba gcad pa des na mthong ngo zhes sems rtsod pa 'di la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bar ti kas btab pa'i lan gang yin pa de brjod pa ni de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: By that, the appearance of those already arisen objects is cut off, and therefore it is seen. The answer to this dispute, which will be explained later, is stated in the verse beginning with If that were so...

original: de'i zhes bya ba'i don gzhan de'i snang ba gang yin pa de bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba'i don gzhan de'i snang ba gang yin pa de bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthat‚Äù is that which is the appearance of that, because it is obscured.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la gal te sgrib pa de nye bar gnas pa'i don gyis rgyab tu gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la gal te sgrib pa de nye bar gnas pa'i don gyis rgyab tu gnas pa yin no //
translated: No, it is not so. If that obscuration is the meaning of ‚Äúabiding near,‚Äù then it is ‚Äúbehind.‚Äù

original: de'i cho ga ba la sogs pa yul tha dad par mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i cho ga ba la sogs pa yul tha dad par mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The ritual master and so on would see different objects.

original: de ni zhes bya ba yul gcig tu rtogs pa ni 'khrul ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba yul gcig tu rtogs pa ni 'khrul ba yin no zhe na /
translated: That is to say, the cognition of a single object is mistaken.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni don zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni don zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, the reply is this:

original: don gyi de kho na nyid mthong ba'i lta ba gang la yod pa rig pa can la sogs pa rnams kyi ltar na 'khrul pa ga la srid gzhan gyi yul la zhes smras te /
analyzed: don gyi de kho na nyid mthong ba'i lta ba gang la yod pa rig pa can la sogs pa rnams kyi ltar na 'khrul pa ga la srid gzhan gyi yul la zhes smras te /
translated: How could there be error in the view that possesses the seeing of the reality of objects, as in the case of the logicians and so on?

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'khrul pa ni srid pa ma yin no zhes pha rol pos bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'khrul pa ni srid pa ma yin no zhes pha rol pos bsams pa'o //
translated: The opponent thinks that error is not possible by the nature of things, since it is characterized by appearance.

original: yul gcig na med pa'i dngos po yang gal te der mthong na de'i tshe dus gcig na med pa'i dngos po ji ltar ji ltar mthong ba dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gcig na med pa'i dngos po yang gal te der mthong na de'i tshe dus gcig na med pa'i dngos po ji ltar ji ltar mthong ba dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: If a thing that does not exist in a certain place is seen there, then how could a thing that does not exist at one time not be seen at that time?

original: mthong ba nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It would be seen, that is the meaning.

original: 'on te dus des med pa yang mthong na 'di la brjod pa ni thams cad don thams cad mthong ba zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te dus des med pa yang mthong na 'di la brjod pa ni thams cad don thams cad mthong ba zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if you say that a thing that does not exist at that time is seen, then the consequence is that everything is seen as everything,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med pa dag kyang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med pa dag kyang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nonexistent past and future are also seen.

original: thams cad thams cad mthong ba nyid yin pa de ltar yang med do //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad mthong ba nyid yin pa de ltar yang med do //
translated: But it is not the case that everything is seen as everything.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni med pa yang 'ga' zhig mthong gi thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni med pa yang 'ga' zhig mthong gi thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú These‚Äù means that some of the nonexistent is seen, but not all.

original: ma mthong ba de nyid las thams cad mthong ba skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gzhan gyis kyang gzhung gzugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba de nyid las thams cad mthong ba skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gzhan gyis kyang gzhung gzugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And others will argue that ‚Äúthe arising of seeing all from that very nonseeing will occur.‚Äù

original: des na 'ga' yang sun dbyung ba'am bsgrub par mi nus par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o zhes bshad pa ni zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa 'di nyid brjod pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'ga' yang sun dbyung ba'am bsgrub par mi nus par 'gyur ro zhes bsams pa'o zhes bshad pa ni zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa 'di nyid brjod pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that the refutation is stated in the same way.

original: gzhan gyis te gsal bar mthong ba gang yin pa de bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis te gsal bar mthong ba gang yin pa de bsgribs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'on te skyes pa byed pa lam yin dus mtshungs pa nyid 'dzin pa yin no snyam na 'grel pa med pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that the other, the unclear one, is seen.üîΩThe word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that the other, the unclear one, is seen

original: yang na gzung pa nyid rang gi rgyus so sor nges pa de 'dra bar bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na gzung pa nyid rang gi rgyus so sor nges pa de 'dra bar bskyed pa yin te /
translated: Or, the object itself is generated by its own cause to be ascertained in that way,

original: gang gi de nyid kyis 'dzin gyi gzhan gyis ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi de nyid kyis 'dzin gyi gzhan gyis ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it is apprehended by that, not by another.

original: yang na gnyis ka yang nges par bskyed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na gnyis ka yang nges par bskyed pa yin te /
translated: Or, both are ascertained and generated,

original: des na thams cad 'dzin par thal ba yin no ;
analyzed: des na thams cad 'dzin par thal ba yin no ;
translated: and therefore it follows that everything would be apprehended.

original: / de dag las zhes bya ba ni yul dang shes pa dag la'o //
analyzed: / de dag las zhes bya ba ni yul dang shes pa dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom those‚Äù refers to objects and consciousnesses.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i dngos po tsam gyis so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i dngos po tsam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that alone‚Äù means by the mere thing that is a co-originator.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ci zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ci zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it arises from the cause of the apprehended and apprehender, what is it?

original: shes pa gnyis ni dus mnyam par yod pa yin no zhe na gnyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes pa gnyis ni dus mnyam par yod pa yin no zhe na gnyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it is said that two consciousnesses exist simultaneously, ‚Äútwo‚Äù is stated.

original: dus mnyam pa na yod pa'i 'dzin pa'i byed pa gcig po de ni de las gzhan pa'i 'dzin par byed pa dang dus mtshungs pa yin la /
analyzed: dus mnyam pa na yod pa'i 'dzin pa'i byed pa gcig po de ni de las gzhan pa'i 'dzin par byed pa dang dus mtshungs pa yin la /
translated: The single activity of apprehending that exists simultaneously with that is simultaneous with the apprehender that is different from it.

original: de bzhin de yang gzhan dang min pas thugs pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin de yang gzhan dang min pas thugs pa med do //
translated: And that is not so for the other, therefore there is no end.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'dzin pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni shes pa 'dzin pa'i dus na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù means at the time of the apprehension of the cognition.

original: gnod par byed pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni dang po zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde'i rang bzhin ni sngar gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni dang po zhes bya ba'o // de'i rang bzhin ni sngar gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù refers to the refutation of the objection.üîΩ‚ÄúIts nature‚Äù is the nature of the object of apprehension.

original: dngos po de ni sngar yang gzung ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po de ni sngar yang gzung ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat entity‚Äù is the nature of the object of apprehension.

original: des na gzung ba ni sngar gyi rang bzhin nyid rtogs so snyam na 'di la brjod pa ni sngar yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des na gzung ba ni sngar gyi rang bzhin nyid rtogs so snyam na 'di la brjod pa ni sngar yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, the apprehension is the realization of the previous nature‚Äù ‚Äî to this we reply:

original: gzung ba'i rang bzhin ni sngar yang med ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rang bzhin ni sngar yang med ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúEven previously, there was no nature of the object of apprehension.‚Äù

original: sngar yang gzung ba yin mod ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: sngar yang gzung ba yin mod ci skyon snyam na /
translated: ‚ÄúEven previously, there was the apprehension‚Äù ‚Äî what is wrong with that?

original: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde zhes bya ba gzung ba'i rnam pa dus mnyam par snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o // de zhes bya ba gzung ba'i rnam pa dus mnyam par snang ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is not a refutation‚Äù ‚ÄîüîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the appearance of the aspect of the object of apprehension.

original: de'i gzung ba'i rnam pa de zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i gzung ba'i rnam pa de zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat apprehension‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúthe aspect of the object of apprehension.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i tshogs las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs so //
analyzed: shes pa'i tshogs las skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs so //
translated: because it arises from a collection of consciousnesses.

original: de lta bu yang zhes bya ba shes pa tshogs pa skyed pa yang don yin na de'i tshe 'dzin par byed pa yang don yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu yang zhes bya ba shes pa tshogs pa skyed pa yang don yin na de'i tshe 'dzin par byed pa yang don yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the collection of consciousnesses is the meaning of ‚Äúsuch,‚Äù then at that time the apprehender would also be the meaning.

original: gzhan du gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sngar yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sngar yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: ‚Äú Transformation‚Äù means that it did not exist previously.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni sngar yod pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni sngar yod pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here it is said: ‚ÄúPreviously existing‚Äù means

original: sngar yod pa ni gzung bar nus pa ma @308b yin no //
analyzed: sngar yod pa ni gzung bar nus pa ma @308b yin no //
translated: that which previously existed cannot be apprehended.

original: rtog go zhe na rtog pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtog go zhe na rtog pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you think it is conceptual, it is said to be conceptual.

original: gzhan gyi lta ba la zhes bya ba ni mod sde ba'i lta ba la'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lta ba la zhes bya ba ni mod sde ba'i lta ba la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In the view of others‚Äù means in the view of the SautraÃÑntikas.

original: de'i rnam par ni don gyi rnam par ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam par ni don gyi rnam par ro //
translated: ‚Äú Its aspect‚Äù is the aspect of the object.

original: gal te de med na ji ltar sngar snyam na rang ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de med na ji ltar sngar snyam na rang ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it does not exist, how can it be thought of previously? It is said to be ‚Äúself-cognized.‚Äù

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa las don rtogs pa yin na da ltar med snyam na don dam par ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa las don rtogs pa yin na da ltar med snyam na don dam par ni zhes smos so //
translated: If it is understood that the object is inferred, it is said that ‚Äúultimately‚Äù it is not.

original: dus mtshungs par 'byung ba nyid kyi 'dzin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: dus mtshungs par 'byung ba nyid kyi 'dzin par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that the apprehension of the simultaneity of the two is the apprehension of the simultaneity of the two,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúthe innate.‚Äù

original: des phan btags pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des phan btags pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it does not assist it.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i don des shes pa la phan btags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i don des shes pa la phan btags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of ‚Äúinnate‚Äù does not assist consciousness.

original: des zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBy it‚Äù means

original: de'i rnam pa can du ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can du ste /
translated: by the aspect of it.

original: skyes pa'i shes pas so //
analyzed: skyes pa'i shes pas so //
translated: The consciousness that arisesüîΩ‚Äúlike that‚Äù means that it arises simultaneously with it.

original: de zhes bya bar dus mtshungs par byung ba de ltar de dang por rig na yang de'i dbang tsam gyis zhes bya ba bye brag pa de'i dbang tsam gyis yin no //
analyzed: de zhes bya bar dus mtshungs par byung ba de ltar de dang por rig na yang de'i dbang tsam gyis zhes bya ba bye brag pa de'i dbang tsam gyis yin no //
translated: Even though it is known first, ‚Äúby the power of that‚Äù means by the power of that Vai≈õe·π£ika alone.

original: shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan du na rig pa mi thad pas so //üîΩde'i rnam pa zhes bya ba don gyi rang bzhin mtha' dag rang gis bdag gir byed 'dzin par byed mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: shugs kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gzhan du na rig pa mi thad pas so // de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba don gyi rang bzhin mtha' dag rang gis bdag gir byed 'dzin par byed mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy force‚Äù means that it is not tenable that it is known in any other way.üîΩ‚ÄúBy its aspect‚Äù means that it is the entire nature of the object, which is taken as its own, apprehended, and made manifest.

original: de'i rnam par mtha' dag rang gis bdag gir byed pa yang de yin la /
analyzed: de'i rnam par mtha' dag rang gis bdag gir byed pa yang de yin la /
translated: It is the entire aspect of that which is taken as its own.

original: myong ba yin pa ste rnam pa de lta bu'i shes pas so //
analyzed: myong ba yin pa ste rnam pa de lta bu'i shes pas so //
translated: It is an experience, i.e., a consciousness having that aspect.

original: 'o na don 'di dus khyab pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na don 'di dus khyab pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: But the object is not apprehended as extending over time,

original: de'i tshe dus gcig dang 'brel par 'dzin pa'i phyir dus gcig gi tshe 'dzin pas ji ltar rtag pa yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe dus gcig dang 'brel par 'dzin pa'i phyir dus gcig gi tshe 'dzin pas ji ltar rtag pa yin /
translated: because it is apprehended at the time of the single moment that is connected with it. How can it be permanent?

original: shes pa de lta ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes pa ni skad cig ma nyid kyis snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa de lta ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes pa ni skad cig ma nyid kyis snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness is not like that. Consciousness is not permanent because it has the nature of the past and future due to momentariness.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni sgyu gnan  la rag las pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni sgyu gnan  la rag las pa'o //
translated: It is transformed. This is dependent on the transformation of the basis.

original: rgyu nye bar bsgrubs pas nye bar gnas par byas pa'i mig la sogs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu nye bar bsgrubs pas nye bar gnas par byas pa'i mig la sogs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: That which is present due to the establishment of the cause is so-called.

original: de rnam par ma chad pas zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnam par ma chad pas so //
analyzed: de rnam par ma chad pas zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa rnam par ma chad pas so //
translated: Because it is not interrupted, i.e., because the eye, etc. are not interrupted.

original: rnam par chad pha med par tshad ma skye pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rnam par chad pa nyid la tshad ma yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par chad pha med par tshad ma skye pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rnam par chad pa nyid la tshad ma yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not that the valid cognition arises without a break, but rather that the valid cognition exists in the very break.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang ni phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyang ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang ni phyogs kyi glang po'i zhal snga nas kyang ngo //
translated: The master DignƒÅga also says this.

original: de bshad pa zhes bya ba 'di ni tshang ma kun las btus pa'i 'grel ba'i gzhung yin no //
analyzed: de bshad pa zhes bya ba 'di ni tshang ma kun las btus pa'i 'grel ba'i gzhung yin no //
translated: This is the text of the commentary on the Compendium of Valid Cognition.

original: gal te 'dir yang yul gyi rnam brjod par byed par med do snyam na der yang zhes gsungs so //üîΩ'dir yul @309a * //
analyzed: gal te 'dir yang yul gyi rnam brjod par byed par med do snyam na der yang zhes gsungs so // 'dir yul @309a * //
translated: If you think that there is no expression of the object here, he says ‚Äúthere also.‚Äù

original: gyi rnam par bsgrub pa'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: gyi rnam par bsgrub pa'i skabs yin no //
translated: Here, the occasion is the establishment of the object.

original: ji ltar shes she na rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: How is that known? He says ‚Äúconsciousness.‚Äù

original: gal te rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis tshul gnyis su 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis tshul gnyis su 'gyur mod /
translated: If you think that the two modes are indeed the object of knowledge and the instrument of knowledge,üîΩbut not by the aspect of the object,

original: yul gyi rnam pas na ma yin no zhes da ltar nyid brjod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pas na ma yin no zhes da ltar nyid brjod pa ma yin na /
translated: then he says,üîΩ‚ÄúThe object is the object of knowledge, and the aspect of that is the instrument of knowledge.‚Äù

original: de ji ltar rnam par shes pa tshul gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod ce na de yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ji ltar rnam par shes pa tshul gnyis pa zhes bya ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod ce na de yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because this is the section called ‚ÄúThe Two Modes of Consciousness.‚Äù

original: des na yul gyi rnam pa nyid kyis tshul gnyis yin gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na yul gyi rnam pa nyid kyis tshul gnyis yin gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the aspect of the object itself is the two modes, but not anything else.üîΩThis is the meaning.

original: de bdag nyid kyis ni rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyis ni rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: By its own nature means by the nature of awareness.

original: rgol ba thams cad kyi ltar na yang rig pa tsam yin no zhes 'dod pa yin gyi rig pa nyid med do zhes ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgol ba thams cad kyi ltar na yang rig pa tsam yin no zhes 'dod pa yin gyi rig pa nyid med do zhes ni ma yin no //
translated: All the opponents agree that it is mere awareness, but they do not agree that it is awareness itself.

original: des na rang rig pa 'ba' zhig bsgrub par rigs so //
analyzed: des na rang rig pa 'ba' zhig bsgrub par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to prove reflexive awareness alone.

original: rang gis myong ba nyid dam zhes bya ba 'di ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i gzhung ste /
analyzed: rang gis myong ba nyid dam zhes bya ba 'di ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i gzhung ste /
translated: ‚Äú Or is it experienced by itself?‚Äù This is the position of Master Dignaga.

original: gzhung 'dis slob dpon phyogs kyi glang por rang rig pa bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhung 'dis slob dpon phyogs kyi glang por rang rig pa bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: This text proves reflexive awareness for Master Dignaga.

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni don dang shes pa dang de'i shes pa la sogs pa phan tshun khyad par can du dran pa gang yin pa de 'dir yang dag dran gyi sgras brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba ni don dang shes pa dang de'i shes pa la sogs pa phan tshun khyad par can du dran pa gang yin pa de 'dir yang dag dran gyi sgras brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúMutual‚Äù means that the memory of the mutual distinction of the object, the cognition, and the cognition of that, etc. is what is meant by the term ‚Äúperfect memory‚Äù here.

original: sngon po'i rnam pa gsal ba so sor nges pa gang yin pa des nye bar brgyud pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa gsal ba so sor nges pa gang yin pa des nye bar brgyud pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: It is by the power of the vivid, distinct memory of the aspect of blue that the memory of the blue is not mistaken.

original: mtshe ma la sogs pa dang la zhes bya ba ni snga tshogs brtson 'grus la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: mtshe ma la sogs pa dang la zhes bya ba ni snga tshogs brtson 'grus la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú Twins, etc.‚Äù refers to the former group of diligence, etc.

original: de la ni gcig mthong ba ni dus phyis kyi sna tshogs brtson 'grus mthong ngam /
analyzed: de la ni gcig mthong ba ni dus phyis kyi sna tshogs brtson 'grus mthong ngam /
translated: In that case, the seeing of one thing is the seeing of the various things of later times.

original: chags lus byin yin zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chags lus byin yin zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: It would be like saying ‚ÄúDevadatta is attached and has a body.‚ÄùüîΩBut it is not a memory that distinguishes them.

original: rnam par phye nas dran pa ni ma yin no de la zhes bya ba yul zhes bya ba ni /üîΩ'khrul pa med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par phye nas dran pa ni ma yin no de la zhes bya ba yul zhes bya ba ni / 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù means in the case of the object.

original: shes pa nyams su myong ba'i skabs su'o //
analyzed: shes pa nyams su myong ba'i skabs su'o //
translated: ‚Äú Because there is no error‚Äù means that it is in the case of the experience of cognition.

original: yul yang nyams su myong ba des na yul yang dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul yang nyams su myong ba des na yul yang dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: And since the object is experienced, the object is also remembered.

original: rang nyid shes pa rang bzhin du tha dad pa med kyang yul de tha dad pa nyid las tha dad pa dran pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid shes pa rang bzhin du tha dad pa med kyang yul de tha dad pa nyid las tha dad pa dran pa'o //
translated: Although the cognition of itself is not different by nature, it is different from the difference of that object, and it is remembered as different.

original: dpe yang 'jig par byed pa ni mtshe ma dag kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe yang 'jig par byed pa ni mtshe ma dag kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example is also for the purpose of refuting.

original: 'on te dran pa khyad par ldan par skyes pa des na dran pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir zhes ji ltar brjod snyam na dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te dran pa khyad par ldan par skyes pa des na dran pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir zhes ji ltar brjod snyam na dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if you think that since memory arises with a special feature, how can it be said that memory is not perception? It is like this.

original: yul gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni yul gsal ba'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: yul gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni yul gsal ba'i dbang gis so //
translated: By the power of the object means by the power of the clear object.

original: de bzhin du dran par bya ba'i rnam pa gzhan du mi @309b 'thad par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dran par bya ba'i rnam pa gzhan du mi @309b 'thad par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is understood that the aspect of the object to be remembered is not tenable as different.

original: de yang rnam pa'i khyad par nyid las khyad par du gyur pa yang rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa'i khyad par nyid las khyad par du gyur pa yang rtogs pa yin no //
translated: And that is also understood as distinguished by the distinction of the aspect itself.

original: de ltar ba'i dran pa'i rtog pa'i yul gyi rnam pa de'o //
analyzed: de ltar ba'i dran pa'i rtog pa'i yul gyi rnam pa de'o //
translated: That is the aspect of the object of the conceptual cognition of memory.

original: des na dran pa la snang ba'i rnam pa de dang de dang ltar ba yin na /
analyzed: des na dran pa la snang ba'i rnam pa de dang de dang ltar ba yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the aspect that appears to memory is just that,

original: ji ltar dran par brjod de yul la rnam pa de mi snang ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: ji ltar dran par brjod de yul la rnam pa de mi snang ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: how can it be called memory, because the aspect does not appear to the object?

original: /'on te rnam pa de ni yul nyid kyi yin la rag go snyam na brjod pa de'i tshe myong ba'i ste /
analyzed: /'on te rnam pa de ni yul nyid kyi yin la rag go snyam na brjod pa de'i tshe myong ba'i ste /
translated: But if you think that the aspect is just that of the object,

original: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa ci ste ma yin /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa ci ste ma yin /
translated: why is it not the aspect of experience?

original: rnam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa yin par khas len na myong ba'i yang yin pas khas blangs te shes pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa yin par khas len na myong ba'i yang yin pas khas blangs te shes pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If you accept that it is consciousness that has the nature of the aspect, you accept that it is also experience, because there is no difference in their being consciousness.

original: 'on te myong ba las dran pa skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te myong ba las dran pa skye ba ma yin te /
translated: But memory does not arise from experience,

original: 'on kyang don nyid las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang don nyid las skye ba yin no //
translated: but it arises from the object itself.

original: des na dran pa rnam par dag ldan pa yin yang myong ba ni rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dran pa rnam par dag ldan pa yin yang myong ba ni rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, although memory is associated with an aspect, experience is not associated with an aspect.

original: dran pa rnam pa'i khyad par ni don de nyid kyis bstan pa'i phyir snyam na dogs pa bsu nas 'di ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: dran pa rnam pa'i khyad par ni don de nyid kyis bstan pa'i phyir snyam na dogs pa bsu nas 'di ltar zhes smos so //
translated: The difference in the aspects of memory is taught by the word ‚Äúthus‚Äù in order to anticipate the objection that memory arises from the object alone, not from experience.

original: gal te don las dran pa 'byung ba'i nyams su myong ba las ma yin na de'i tshe khyad par med ba rgyu de'i phyir na don kun la 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te don las dran pa 'byung ba'i nyams su myong ba las ma yin na de'i tshe khyad par med ba rgyu de'i phyir na don kun la 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If memory arises from the object alone, not from experience, then there would be no difference between the two. For that reason, memory would arise from all objects.

original: 'on te don thag ring ba la sogs pa kun la dran pa mi 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te don thag ring ba la sogs pa kun la dran pa mi 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: But if memory does not arise from all objects, such as those that are distant,üîΩthen why does memory arise from some objects?

original: dngos rnams rnam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos rnams rnam zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThings are remembered‚Äù means that memory arises from some objects.

original: gang gi phyir rgyang ring po dang chod pa la yang dran pa skye ba kho na yin te /üîΩdes rgyang ring po la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyang ring po dang chod pa la yang dran pa skye ba kho na yin te / des rgyang ring po la sogs pas so //
translated: Memory arises from distant and obscured objects.

original: dran pa skye ba la mi gnod pa'i phyir na don thams cad la dran pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa skye ba la mi gnod pa'i phyir na don thams cad la dran pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it does not prevent the arising of memory, memory arises from all objects.

original: 'on te don de nyid myong ba la brten nas rgyu yin no zhe na myong ba de nyid rgyur 'gyur mod /
analyzed: 'on te don de nyid myong ba la brten nas rgyu yin no zhe na myong ba de nyid rgyur 'gyur mod /
translated: But if memory arises in dependence on the experience of the object itself, then that experience is the cause of memory.

original: de'i phyir myong ba ni don gyi rgyu ma yin gyi 'on kyang myong ba 'ga' zhig yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir myong ba ni don gyi rgyu ma yin gyi 'on kyang myong ba 'ga' zhig yin no //
translated: Therefore, experience is not the cause of the object, but rather some experience is.

original: 'on te dran pas rnam pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa dmigs su chug mod /
analyzed: 'on te dran pas rnam pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa dmigs su chug mod /
translated: But suppose you grant that consciousness endowed with the aspect is perceived by memory.

original: de lta na yang de ni de lta bu ma yin no snyam na /üîΩgang zhig mos pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang de ni de lta bu ma yin no snyam na / gang zhig mos pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even so, it is not like that.üîΩWhat is it like?

original: de las zhes bya ba ni dpe las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni dpe las so //
translated: ‚ÄúLike a dream‚Äù means like the example of a dream.

original: de lta bu'i bdag nyid can la ni zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can la'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bdag nyid can la ni zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike that‚Äù means like the nature of the grasped and grasper.

original: 'o na blo ni rang gi bdag nyid kyis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gsal bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'o na blo ni rang gi bdag nyid kyis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gsal bar bya ba yin la /
translated: But if the mind is the object of knowledge by itself, it is the manifest,

original: don yang rig par byed pas gsal bar byed pa yang yin no snyam na /
analyzed: don yang rig par byed pas gsal bar byed pa yang yin no snyam na /
translated: and the object is also the manifest because it causes knowledge.

original: 'di la smras pa ni blo dman gnyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la smras pa ni blo dman gnyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the response to that is ‚ÄúThe two inferior . . .‚Äù

original: dper na dbang po don @310a * //
analyzed: dper na dbang po don @310a * //
translated: For example, the object of a sense consciousness

original: gyis gsal bar byed pa yin yang rang gi bdag nyid rig pa nges pa ma yin pa de bzhin du blo yang yin zhes bya ba'i don du dbang po nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: gyis gsal bar byed pa yin yang rang gi bdag nyid rig pa nges pa ma yin pa de bzhin du blo yang yin zhes bya ba'i don du dbang po nye bar bkod do //
translated: although it illuminates itself, it is not ascertained. In the same way, the mind is also. This is the meaning of the example of the sense faculty.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol nyid sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol nyid sangs rgyas pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: If, etc. is the objection of the opponent.

original: de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: That is not so, etc. is the refutation.

original: der yang ni bdag la'o //
analyzed: der yang ni bdag la'o //
translated: There also means in regard to the self.

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni rdzas gzhan dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni rdzas gzhan dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the latter half is: and another substance.

original: khyed lan sangs rgyas pa'i cha la ni'o //
analyzed: khyed lan sangs rgyas pa'i cha la ni'o //
translated: In your reply, etc.

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pa gang la yod pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pa gang la yod pa ma yin pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: That which does not exist in the understanding of others is so called.

original: de rtogs phyir zhes bya ba ni don gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtogs phyir zhes bya ba ni don gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of understanding that, etc. means for the sake of the manifestation of the object.

original: mar me la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gsal byed gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mar me la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gsal byed gzhan la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: A lamp, etc. is not so, etc. means it does not depend on another illuminator.

original: 'on te sgron ma yang dbang po gsal bar bya ba yin no snyam na dbang po yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te sgron ma yang dbang po gsal bar bya ba yin no snyam na dbang po yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if you think that the lamp also illuminates the sense faculty, then the sense faculty also is said.

original: de zhes bya ba ni sgron ma la'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni sgron ma la'o //
translated: That is, the lamp.

original: bde ba la sogs pa bdag gis rtogs pa des na ji ltar rig par byed pa gzhan med snyam na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa bdag gis rtogs pa des na ji ltar rig par byed pa gzhan med snyam na /
translated: If you think that since pleasure, etc. are realized by the self, how can there be another cognizer?

original: bde stsogs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bde stsogs zhes gsungs so //
translated: Pleasure, etc. are said.

original: phyi rol nyid du zhes bya ba bum pa la sogs pa ltar phyi rol gyi yul du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid du zhes bya ba bum pa la sogs pa ltar phyi rol gyi yul du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As external means that they appear as external objects like pots, etc.

original: 'phrod pa 'du bas bsdus pa'i dbang gis bde ba la sogs pa phyi rol ma yin pa nyid du snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du bas bsdus pa'i dbang gis bde ba la sogs pa phyi rol ma yin pa nyid du snang ngo zhe na /
translated: If you think that pleasure, etc. appear as not external due to the power of the collection of sense faculties,

original: de'i tshe de nyid rang gi rig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de nyid rang gi rig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time they would be just one's own awareness.

original: so sor ma grub pa dag las 'phrod pa 'du ba zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: so sor ma grub pa dag las 'phrod pa 'du ba zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: The collection is said to be from the unestablished individual things.

original: bum pa dang snam bu dag bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu dag bzhin no //
translated: Like a pot and a cloth.

original: gal te bdag dang bde ba la sogs pa yang so so ma yin pa grub na de'i tshe tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bdag dang bde ba la sogs pa yang so so ma yin pa grub na de'i tshe tha dad pa med pa'i phyir rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If the self, pleasure, etc. were established as not distinct, then, because they would not be different, they would have the nature of self-awareness.

original: bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is like the self.

original: 'di ni 'phrod pa 'du ba khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi de yang med do zhes brjod pa ni 'du ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'phrod pa 'du ba khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi de yang med do zhes brjod pa ni 'du ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is merely stated on the assumption of contact, but that is also non-existent, as stated in ‚Äúcontact.‚Äù

original: gang la'o snyam pa'i shes pa 'jug pa de nyid 'dzin par byed pa yin la gang du mi 'jug pa de nyid ni gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnyi ga yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gang la'o snyam pa'i shes pa 'jug pa de nyid 'dzin par byed pa yin la gang du mi 'jug pa de nyid ni gzung ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnyi ga yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The thought ‚Äúit is in this‚Äù is the apprehender, and that in which it does not occur is the apprehended. Both of these are not so, as stated in ‚Äúthat is not so.‚Äù

original: de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not so‚Äù means that is not so.

original: de yod na yang zhes bya ba ni pa'o snyam pa'i rtog pa yod kyang ngo //
analyzed: de yod na yang zhes bya ba ni pa'o snyam pa'i rtog pa yod kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it exists‚Äù means even if the thought ‚ÄúI‚Äù exists.

original: ma mthong ba ni rang rig pa nyid ma yin par ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni rang rig pa nyid ma yin par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot seen‚Äù means not self-awareness.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni nga'o snyam pa'i rtog pa dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni nga'o snyam pa'i rtog pa dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLikewise‚Äù means connected with the thought ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: sngo bsangs la sogs pa la ni nga'o snyam pa'i rtog pa mthong gi / gzugs la sogs pa la ni ma yin no @310b snyam na /
analyzed: sngo bsangs la sogs pa la ni nga'o snyam pa'i rtog pa mthong gi / gzugs la sogs pa la ni ma yin no @310b snyam na /
translated: If you think that the idea ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is seen in relation to a pale complexion, etc., but not in relation to form, etc.,

original: sngo bsangs la sogs pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: sngo bsangs la sogs pa zhes smos so //
translated: then the root text states, ‚Äúpale complexion, etc.‚Äù

original: 'o na bdag go snyam pa'i rtog pa gzugs kyi rgyu mtshan yin mod snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na bdag go snyam pa'i rtog pa gzugs kyi rgyu mtshan yin mod snyam na /
translated: If you think that the idea ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is the cause of the idea of form,

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the root text states, ‚Äúform, etc.‚Äù

original: rtogs pa 'di ni 'dzin par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan la /
analyzed: rtogs pa 'di ni 'dzin par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan la /
translated: This idea is the cause of the apprehension of the sign of the self.

original: gang la nga dkar mo snyam par rtogs pa ni nye bar btags pa las /
analyzed: gang la nga dkar mo snyam par rtogs pa ni nye bar btags pa las /
translated: The idea ‚ÄúI am white‚Äù is due to the designation of the self as white.

original: 'gyur ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif you think‚Äù refers to the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif that is so‚Äù refers to the conclusion.

original: tha dad med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha dad med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they are not different‚Äù means

original: dkar sham dang gzugs gnyis la tha dad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkar sham dang gzugs gnyis la tha dad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that a pale complexion and form are not different.

original: nga'o snyam pa ldog pas zhes bya ba med pas so //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa ldog pas zhes bya ba med pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause the idea ‚ÄòI am‚Äô is eliminated‚Äù means because the idea ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is eliminated.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rngo ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rngo ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat very‚Äù refers to the pale complexion.

original: rang rig min nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa la sogs pa bdag rig pa nyid ma yin yang ngo //
analyzed: rang rig min nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa la sogs pa bdag rig pa nyid ma yin yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúNor is it non-reflexive‚Äù means that a wall, etc. is not reflexive.

original: des na rang rig pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du khyad par med kyang ji ltar de gnyis tha dad pa de bzhin du rang rig pa yin yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na rang rig pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du khyad par med kyang ji ltar de gnyis tha dad pa de bzhin du rang rig pa yin yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, although there is no difference in their non-reflexive nature, the meaning is that just as those two are different, so it is with reflexive awareness.

original: 'on te mig gnyis la sogs pa'i 'dzin par byad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te mig gnyis la sogs pa'i 'dzin par byad par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is the apprehender of the two eyes, etc.,

original: des na ji ltar rang rig par 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar rang rig par 'grub snyam na /
translated: then how is reflexive awareness established?

original: mig ni zhes bya ba la sogs min ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mig ni zhes bya ba la sogs min ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe eye,‚Äù etc. is said.

original: de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù means in terms of reflexive awareness.

original: 'brel pa mi rtag phyir zhes bya ba ni rtag tu rtsig pa dang 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa mi rtag phyir zhes bya ba ni rtag tu rtsig pa dang 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the connection is impermanent‚Äù means that it is not always connected to the wall,

original: de na res 'ga' kho na dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na res 'ga' kho na dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is sometimes observed there.

original: lus ni thams cad kyi rjes su 'brel par dmigs pa des ngar 'dzin pa de ni lus de dang 'brel par 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩgzhan yang gang gis ngar 'dzin pa med pas rtsig pa rang rig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba ngar 'dzin pa'i phyir ni rang rig pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: lus ni thams cad kyi rjes su 'brel par dmigs pa des ngar 'dzin pa de ni lus de dang 'brel par 'gyur ba yin no // gzhan yang gang gis ngar 'dzin pa med pas rtsig pa rang rig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba ngar 'dzin pa'i phyir ni rang rig pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: Since the body is observed to be related to all, the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is related to that body.üîΩMoreover, since there is no conception of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù the wall is not self-awareness.

original: 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not established as self-awareness because of the conception of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: gzhan la ltos pa med par rig pa tsam gyis de ltar rang rig pa nyid du tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med par rig pa tsam gyis de ltar rang rig pa nyid du tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different from mere awareness that does not depend on another.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rtsig pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the wall.

original: de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba 'dzin pa'i rnam par rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba 'dzin pa'i rnam par rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Its aspect‚Äù is not the apprehending cognition.

original: mig la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i 'dzin par byed pa gzhan ni 'dir cung zad dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i 'dzin par byed pa gzhan ni 'dir cung zad dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, nothing else is observed as an apprehender that is separate from the eyes and so on.

original: 'o na mig la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na mig la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the eyes and so on are the apprehender,

original: de kun zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de kun zhes gsungs te /
translated: then the root text declares, ‚ÄúAll of them.‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The eyes and so on.

original: 'o na bde ba la sogs pa nyid 'dzin par byed pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na bde ba la sogs pa nyid 'dzin par byed pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that pleasure, etc. themselves are the apprehenders,

original: de la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the root text states, ‚ÄúThat is not so.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa de la ma gtogs pa @311a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de la ma gtogs pa @311a * //
translated: Apart from form, etc.

original: ro ; / pha rol gyi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes smras te tha dad par ro //
analyzed: ro ; / pha rol gyi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes smras te tha dad par ro //
translated: The opponent says that it is a transformation of the other, i.e., of form, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'dod pa dang 'dod pa ma yin pa tha dad pa na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'dod pa dang 'dod pa ma yin pa tha dad pa na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug par snang gi rim bzhin snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug par snang gi rim bzhin snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the appearance of the pleasant and the unpleasant is in accordance with the difference between what is desired and what is not desired.

original: mi sdug ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi sdug ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The unpleasant, etc.

original: des zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the apprehender.üîΩHere, too, the opponent says that consciousness is implied because it is not shared.

original: 'di la yang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir shes pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin ba yal bar dor nas gzhan brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir shes pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin ba yal bar dor nas gzhan brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúIf that is so,‚Äù i.e., if consciousness is not shared, then the consequence is that consciousness itself is implied.

original: 'jig rten ni rig pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni rig pa ste /
translated: The world is aware,

original: don gyis go bas shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyis go bas shes pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not consciousness because it is understood by implication.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gzugs las rang bzhin tha dad du'o //
analyzed: gzugs las rang bzhin tha dad du'o //
translated: It is different in nature from form.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: blo de'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni gsal ba'i ngo bor ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo de'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni gsal ba'i ngo bor ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aspect of that awareness is not realized as the nature of clarity.

original: gal te blo'i rang bzhin lus can ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te blo'i rang bzhin lus can ma yin na /
translated: If the nature of awareness is not embodied,

original: 'o na de'i rang bzhin ci 'dra ba zhig yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i rang bzhin ci 'dra ba zhig yin snyam na /
translated: then what is its nature like?

original: de'i rang bzhin ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Its nature is like this.

original: gal te ri bong gi rva la sogs par 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin de ltar ma rtogs pa'i phyir 'dzin pa ma yin no snyam na brjod pa /
analyzed: gal te ri bong gi rva la sogs par 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin de ltar ma rtogs pa'i phyir 'dzin pa ma yin no snyam na brjod pa /
translated: If you think that it does not apprehend because it does not realize the nature of the apprehension of the rabbit‚Äôs horns, and so on, then it is said:

original: blo yang rtogs pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: blo yang rtogs pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Awareness is also not realized at all.

original: des na de'i yang 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na de'i yang 'dzin par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it does not apprehend that either,

original: ri bong gi rva nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva nyid bzhin no //
translated: just like the rabbit‚Äôs horns.

original: 'on te nga'i blo yod do snyam par rtogs na /
analyzed: 'on te nga'i blo yod do snyam par rtogs na /
translated: But if you think, ‚ÄúMy awareness exists,‚Äù

original: nga'i blo zhes gsungs so //üîΩgzugs la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i rig pa yang yod pa pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nga'i blo zhes gsungs so // gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i rig pa yang yod pa pa ma yin te /
translated: then it is said: My awareness.üîΩAlso, there is no cognition that is different from form and so on.

original: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid rig pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid rig pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: However, the nature of form and so on is cognition.

original: de gcig ces bya ba 'dzin par byed pa dang / gzung bar bya ba gcig rtogs pa med pa'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: de gcig ces bya ba 'dzin par byed pa dang / gzung bar bya ba gcig rtogs pa med pa'i phyir na'o //
translated: because there is no apprehension of a single apprehender and a single apprehended object.

original: gzhan du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gcig ma rtogs na yang gzhan yang ma rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gcig ma rtogs na yang gzhan yang ma rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that if one is not apprehended, the other is also not apprehended.

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni gcig rtogs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni gcig rtogs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is explained as follows: ‚ÄúIf one is apprehended, the other is also apprehended.‚Äù

original: ji ltar na 'di ltar gsal zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di ltar gsal zhe na /
translated: How is this clear?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOf form, etc.‚Äù

original: gcig rtogs pas gzhan yang gdon mi za bar rtogs pa'i phyir 'dir thal bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes ji ltar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig rtogs pas gzhan yang gdon mi za bar rtogs pa'i phyir 'dir thal bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes ji ltar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Since one is apprehended, the other is also apprehended. How could this be a consequence here? This is the idea.

original: 'dzin par byed pa nyid ces bya ba ni gzung ba ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa nyid ces bya ba ni gzung ba ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAs an apprehender‚Äù means not as an apprehended object.

original: gal te 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir dran pa de'i tshe gzung ba yang dran pa yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir dran pa de'i tshe gzung ba yang dran pa yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If memory is of that because it is an apprehender, then the apprehended object is also remembered.

original: spyi la ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: spyi la ni zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúOf a universal‚Äù is stated.

original: gal te zhes rtogs so zhes tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ji ltar rang rig pa @311b yin no ste /
analyzed: gal te zhes rtogs so zhes tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ji ltar rang rig pa @311b yin no ste /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúI know,‚Äù then how can it be reflexive awareness?

original: gzhan gyis rig par bya ba nyid du zhen pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rig par bya ba nyid du zhen pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is conceived as something that is known by another.

original: ngas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ngas zhes gsungs so //
translated: I have said this.

original: blo de ni gzhan gyis 'dzin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: blo de ni gzhan gyis 'dzin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: That mind is apprehended by another,

original: rang gi ngo bos sa rig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos sa rig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but it is not reflexive awareness by virtue of its own essence. This is the meaning.

original: yang ji ltar na rig pa snga ma 'gags snyam na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na rig pa snga ma 'gags snyam na /
translated: Moreover, how can the previous cognition cease?

original: de ni zhes gsungs te blo'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes gsungs te blo'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the mind.

original: gzung bar bya ba myong ba snga ma'i rang bzhin yang 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba myong ba snga ma'i rang bzhin yang 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The previous experience of the object to be apprehended also ceases.

original: gal te myong ba snga ma'i rang bzhin med mod de lta na yang de ni nyams su myong ba kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: gal te myong ba snga ma'i rang bzhin med mod de lta na yang de ni nyams su myong ba kho na'o snyam na /
translated: Even if the previous experience does not exist, still it is experienced.

original: rang gi med pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi med pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIts nonexistence is experienced.‚Äù

original: 'o na myong ba gnyis pa bdag gi rang bzhin rig pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na myong ba gnyis pa bdag gi rang bzhin rig pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the second experience is reflexive awareness,

original: rang gi rang bzhin yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIts own nature is also not experienced.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the nature of the object.

original: 'on te shes pa yul gyi rnam pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes khas len na de'i rang rig pa nyid khas blang bar bya ba yin pa des na mngon bar 'dod pa grub po //
analyzed: 'on te shes pa yul gyi rnam pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes khas len na de'i rang rig pa nyid khas blang bar bya ba yin pa des na mngon bar 'dod pa grub po //
translated: But if you accept that consciousness is the form of the object, then you must accept reflexive awareness, and thus your original assertion is proven.

original: 'on te yul gyi rnam pa ni 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on te yul gyi rnam pa ni 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: But if you accept that the form of the object is the form of consciousness,

original: 'on kyang de ni gzhan gyis myong ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni gzhan gyis myong ba yin no snyam na /
translated: then you must accept that the object is experienced by another consciousness.

original: thug ba med par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thug ba med par zhes gsungs so //
translated: This would lead to an infinite regress.

original: bzlog pa'i rnam 'grel gyis brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzlog pa'i rnam 'grel gyis brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: The Commentary on the Refutation of Errors states:üîΩ‚ÄúIf you say that the form of the object is the form of consciousness, then the form of consciousness must be the form of another consciousness, and so on ad infinitum.‚Äù

original: rang nyid thal ba brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //üîΩblo yang spyi'i dngos po nyid du rtogs pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas rnam 'grel las brjod pa'i bzlog pa ni /
analyzed: rang nyid thal ba brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o // blo yang spyi'i dngos po nyid du rtogs pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas rnam 'grel las brjod pa'i bzlog pa ni /
translated: The Commentary on the Refutation of Errors states:

original: blo ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: blo ni zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIf you say that the form of the object is the form of consciousness, then the form of consciousness must be the form of another consciousness, and so on ad infinitum.‚Äù

original: dran pas blo 'dzin pa na yang bdag gi ba nyid kyis nang du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pas blo 'dzin pa na yang bdag gi ba nyid kyis nang du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When memory apprehends consciousness, it appears as if it were internal.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du phyogs par ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du phyogs par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means that it appears as if it were external.
