original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni blo de ma ngon sum gyis 'dzin pa ni rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni blo de ma ngon sum gyis 'dzin pa ni rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This also means that the apprehension of that cognition is different from its own nature.üîΩThus, it is directed externally.

original: de ltar phyi rol du phyogs pa yin no zhes ji ltar mi 'dod pa sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol du phyogs pa yin no zhes ji ltar mi 'dod pa sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
translated: How is this not accepted? Another refutation is stated:

original: tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Different from the apprehender.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa dang tha mi dad par ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa dang tha mi dad par ro //
translated: Thus means not different from the apprehender.

original: yul mtshungs kyang zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang ro la sogs par ro //
analyzed: yul mtshungs kyang zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang ro la sogs par ro //
translated: Even though the object is similar means even though the object is form, taste, and so on.

original: 'on te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa 'dres pas rnam par dbye ba ma rtogs pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa 'dres pas rnam par dbye ba ma rtogs pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that because the apprehended and apprehender are mixed, the distinction is not understood,üîΩthe response is:

original: 'dres pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dres pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of mixing.

original: dper na gong bu'i rnam pa 'dzin pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gong bu'i rnam pa 'dzin pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like apprehending the aspect of a mass.

original: thams cad cir yang mi rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam pa nyams su mi myong na /
analyzed: thams cad cir yang mi rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yul gyi rnam pa nyams su mi myong na /
translated: Everything would be impossible means that if the aspect of the object is not experienced,

original: yul yang nyams su myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul yang nyams su myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the object is not experienced. This is the meaning.

original: rang gi tshig le 'ur byas @312a * //
analyzed: rang gi tshig le 'ur byas @312a * //
translated: The verse is his own composition.üîΩThe commentary on it in the Pramiirwvarttika is as follows:

original: pas rnam 'grel las 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde'i ngo bor yul rnam par ro //
analyzed: pas rnam 'grel las 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o // de'i ngo bor yul rnam par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù refers to the verse.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni de'i rnam pa nyid don myong ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni de'i rnam pa nyid don myong ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the experience of the object in the aspect of that.

original: de'i bya bar rang rig pa'i rang bzhin med na'o //
analyzed: de'i bya bar rang rig pa'i rang bzhin med na'o //
translated: If it did not have the nature of self-awareness, it would not be an experience of the object.

original: don yang rig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don yang rig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the object would not be cognized.

original: 'on te rang rig pa med na ji ltar blo yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rang rig pa med na ji ltar blo yin no zhe na /
translated: But if there is no self-awareness, how can it be cognition?

original: gzhan rig pas zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan rig pas zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy cognizing another‚Äù is the reply.

original: 'on te rig pa blo'i mtshan nyid yin pa des na ji ltar de med par der 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te rig pa blo'i mtshan nyid yin pa des na ji ltar de med par der 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But if cognition is the definition of cognition, how can it be cognition if it does not exist?

original: don gyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don gyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the object‚Äù is the reply.

original: bdag kyang zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyi 'dod pa'o //üîΩde ni rang rig pa yin gyi blo'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag kyang zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyi 'dod pa'o // de ni rang rig pa yin gyi blo'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSelf‚Äù refers to the belief of the Samkhyas.üîΩThat is self-awareness, but it is not the nature of cognition.

original: des na bdag nyid rig pa ni blo'i mtshan nyid ma yin te 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na bdag nyid rig pa ni blo'i mtshan nyid ma yin te 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, self-awareness is not the definition of cognition, because it is mistaken.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang 'dra ba'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang 'dra ba'i rnam pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another‚Äù means by a form that is like another.

original: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam pa tsam yin na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam pa tsam yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù means when it is merely that form.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni de'i rnam pa tsam gyi zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'on te 'du ba'i 'grel pa'am gzhan gyis bdag rtag pa'am khyab pa la gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid blo yin pa des na yul gyi rnam pa des kyang gzhan ni blo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni de'i rnam pa tsam gyi zhes bya ba'o // 'on te 'du ba'i 'grel pa'am gzhan gyis bdag rtag pa'am khyab pa la gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid blo yin pa des na yul gyi rnam pa des kyang gzhan ni blo nyid ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself is expressed‚Äù means that it is merely that form.

original: bdag la gnas pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: bdag la gnas pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if the commentary on the compendium or another says that the self, which is permanent and pervasive, is cognition, then by that cognition, even the form of the object is cognition, and another is not cognition because it does not abide in the self.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de yang mi rung ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de yang mi rung ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the response is ‚ÄúThat is also not tenable.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe rtsol ba gcig la rtsol ba gzhan skyes pa de'i tshe rtsol ba gnyis phan tshun blo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rtsol ba gcig la rtsol ba gzhan skyes pa de'i tshe rtsol ba gnyis phan tshun blo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When one effort produces another effort, at that time the two efforts would be mutually cognition.

original: bdag la gnas pa'ang ji ltar rig cing rtogs te /
analyzed: bdag la gnas pa'ang ji ltar rig cing rtogs te /
translated: How could it be known that it abides in the self?

original: bdag nyid mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is intended that it is not known because it is not known by itself.

original: ci ste tha dad par ma rtogs na de'i bdag nyid kyang blo gnyis las tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur te de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste tha dad par ma rtogs na de'i bdag nyid kyang blo gnyis las tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur te de ltar ma yin te /
translated: But if they are not perceived as different, then their identity would be perceived as different from the two cognitions, but that is not the case.

original: rten gyi tha dad par mi rtogs na brten pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten gyi tha dad par mi rtogs na brten pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the difference of the basis is not perceived, the supported is not perceived.

original: gtan tshigs des 'di gsum zhes bya ba blo gnyis dang bdag de gsum mo //
analyzed: gtan tshigs des 'di gsum zhes bya ba blo gnyis dang bdag de gsum mo //
translated: The reason is this: ‚Äúthese three‚Äù are the two cognitions and that self.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni bdag ma rtogs par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni bdag ma rtogs par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is clarified by ‚Äúwithout perceiving a self.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù ‚ÄúForm, etc.‚Äù refers to pots, etc.

original: des na ji ltar bdag ma rtogs na de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa yang de la brten pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ji ltar bdag ma rtogs na de'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa yang de la brten pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, how could form, etc. be perceived as supported on it, when the self is not perceived?

original: de las zhes bya ba blo las tha dad par ro //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba blo las tha dad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the cognition.

original: gang gi phyir byed pa po med pa'i phyir bya ba mi srid pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byed pa po med pa'i phyir bya ba mi srid pa des na /
translated: Since an action is not possible without an agent, therefore

original: gdon mi za bar bdag yod dgos la byed pa po yang bdag yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bdag yod dgos la byed pa po yang bdag yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: the self must exist, and the agent is the self.

original: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' ba'i'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' ba'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEye, etc.‚Äù is the opinion of the philosophers.

original: de @312b dag gi zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste dmigs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de @312b dag gi zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste dmigs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTheir‚Äù refers to the doubts, i.e., the objects of reference.

original: len ni byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: len ni byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTaking‚Äù means ‚Äúmaking.‚Äù

original: gal te mig la sogs pa nyid byed pa po yin na ji ltar byed pa yin /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa nyid byed pa po yin na ji ltar byed pa yin /
translated: If the eye, etc. are the agent, how is it that they are the action?

original: de nyid byed pa po dang bya ba yang 'thad pa ni ma yin no zhe na de dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid byed pa po dang bya ba yang 'thad pa ni ma yin no zhe na de dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is not tenable that they are both the agent and the action.

original: byed pa po bdag gzhan med par mig la sogs pa de dag byed par mi 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po bdag gzhan med par mig la sogs pa de dag byed par mi 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that those eye, etc. are not the agent in the absence of a self as agent.

original: byed pa po dang byed pa'i dngos po ni brtags pa yin pa'i phyir gcig nyid byed pa po dang byed par yang 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po dang byed pa'i dngos po ni brtags pa yin pa'i phyir gcig nyid byed pa po dang byed par yang 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Because the state of being an agent and the state of being an action are imputed, the very same thing can be both the agent and the action.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rang gi blo nus kyi nang du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rang gi blo nus kyi nang du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFor that very reason‚Äù means because it is included within the capacity of one‚Äôs own mind.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni nang du phyogs par snang ba nyid du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni nang du phyogs par snang ba nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that it would appear as if it were included within.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the objection is, ‚ÄúWell then‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs nye bar sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äútherefore‚Äù is the summary.

original: de la ni zhes bya ba gzhan gyi lan de la ni'o //
analyzed: de la ni zhes bya ba gzhan gyi lan de la ni'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that case‚Äù refers to the opponent‚Äôs response.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba phan tshun 'dra ba'i don de dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba phan tshun 'dra ba'i don de dag kyang ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose also‚Äù refers to the fact that the two are similar.

original: 'o na sngar don rnams rig par thal bar brjod kyi blor thal ba ni ma yin no zhes dogs na myong bar thal lo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'o na sngar don rnams rig par thal bar brjod kyi blor thal ba ni ma yin no zhes dogs na myong bar thal lo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If you think that the consequence of the opponent‚Äôs position is that objects are cognized, not that consciousness is cognized, then the response is that the consequence is that consciousness experiences itself.üîΩThe response to the opponent‚Äôs position is that the consequence is that consciousness experiences itself.

original: rang rig par thal lo zhes brjod ba'i sangs rgyas pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis 'dra ba de dag nyid du thal lo zhes brjod ba yin no //
analyzed: rang rig par thal lo zhes brjod ba'i sangs rgyas pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis 'dra ba de dag nyid du thal lo zhes brjod ba yin no //
translated: In response to the opponent‚Äôs argument that consciousness is cognized, the Buddhist says that the consequence is that consciousness experiences itself.üîΩHow does the opponent respond to the Buddhist‚Äôs argument that consciousness experiences itself?üîΩThe opponent‚Äôs response is that consciousness is similar to itself.

original: de la zhes bya ba sangs rgyas pas blor thal ba bsgrub pa la de nyid ces bya ba blo nyid yin par 'dra ba nyid lan du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba sangs rgyas pas blor thal ba bsgrub pa la de nyid ces bya ba blo nyid yin par 'dra ba nyid lan du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that case‚Äù refers to the opponent‚Äôs response to the Buddhist‚Äôs argument that consciousness is cognized.

original: khyad par med pa nyid ston pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa nyid ston pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat itself‚Äù refers to consciousness.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúhow could that be‚Äù means that the opponent‚Äôs response is not a good response.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni myong ba las khyad par gzhan brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni myong ba las khyad par gzhan brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of that‚Äù means that the opponent‚Äôs response is not a good response because it does not state a reason that is different from the experience of consciousness.

original: khyad par de yang 'dra ba las kyang gzhan yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par de yang 'dra ba las kyang gzhan yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: And that difference should be said to be from that which is similar.

original: de ltar ma yin na bum pa la sogs ba mtshungs pa yang rig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na bum pa la sogs ba mtshungs pa yang rig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that even a pot, etc., would be cognized.

original: thal ba 'dir mi 'gyur te 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: thal ba 'dir mi 'gyur te 'dzin par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: This consequence does not apply, because it is not a cognizer.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To this, the response is: ‚ÄúIf it were not so, etc. ‚Äù

original: 'dzin par byed pa nyid 'ga' zhig rnam par gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa nyid 'ga' zhig rnam par gnas pa yin na /
translated: If the nature of a cognizer were established as something,

original: 'dzin bar byed pa 'di las zlog pa ni 'dzin par byed bam yin par gnas pa zhig ni de nyid ces bya ba 'dzin par byed ba nyid ni gnas pa med do //
analyzed: 'dzin bar byed pa 'di las zlog pa ni 'dzin par byed bam yin par gnas pa zhig ni de nyid ces bya ba 'dzin par byed ba nyid ni gnas pa med do //
translated: then the opposite of this cognizer, which is not a cognizer, would be established as that very thing, and the nature of a cognizer would not be established.

original: der zhes bya ba tshad ma can ma yin pa gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par rtogs na'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba tshad ma can ma yin pa gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par rtogs na'o //
translated: ‚Äú There‚Äù means if one understands the valid cognizer to be different from form, etc.

original: ci'i don du zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dra ba blo'i mtshan nyid ma yin na'o //
analyzed: ci'i don du zhes bya ba ni gal te 'dra ba blo'i mtshan nyid ma yin na'o //
translated: ‚Äú For what purpose‚Äù means if similarity is not the characteristic of cognition.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni des zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni des zhes bya ba ste /
translated: To this, the response is: ‚ÄúBy that, etc. ‚Äù

original: shes pas byas pa'i myong ba gang yin pa de sngon po dang seng bo @313a * //
analyzed: shes pas byas pa'i myong ba gang yin pa de sngon po dang seng bo @313a * //
translated: Whatever experience is produced by consciousness is not the object of that consciousness.üîΩ

original: la sogs pa'i yul can du nges ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba rnam par 'jog par byed pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir 'dra ba de tshad mar 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i yul can du nges ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba rnam par 'jog par byed pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir 'dra ba de tshad mar 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Whatever experience is produced by consciousness is posited as the cause of the ascertainment that it is the subject of an object such as blue or yellow. Therefore, we accept that resemblance is a valid cognition.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba rang rig pa dang 'dra ba dag tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba bden mod kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba rang rig pa dang 'dra ba dag tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba bden mod kyi'o //
translated: It is true that the so-called ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the so-called ‚Äúresemblance‚Äù are not different.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni 'dra bas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni 'dra bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy this‚Äù means by resemblance.

original: gzhan gyis ni zhes bya ba ni tshul lugs gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni zhes bya ba ni tshul lugs gzhan gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another‚Äù means by another system.

original: 'on te rang gi ngo bo rig pa'i sgo nyid nas phyi'i don ci ste rnam par mi gzhag snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi ngo bo rig pa'i sgo nyid nas phyi'i don ci ste rnam par mi gzhag snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhy is an external object not posited from the perspective of the awareness of its own nature?‚Äù

original: re zhig ces smos so //
analyzed: re zhig ces smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúFirst of all‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de ltar ma yin par zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba med par ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin par zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba med par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot like that‚Äù means not having resemblance.

original: gzhan rig na ji ltar gzhan rig par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan rig na ji ltar gzhan rig par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it cognizes another, how does it cognize another?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan rig pa ni gang gi tshe 'di bdag gis rtogs so zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan rig pa ni gang gi tshe 'di bdag gis rtogs so zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The other-awareness is when one uses the expression, ‚ÄúI have understood this.‚Äù

original: de'i ngo bo ni de dang 'dra ba'o //üîΩdper na tsi tra aang ga dang sna tshogs brtson 'grus las gang yang rung ba zhig mthong ba ni gzhan la bdag gis rig go zhes bya bar tha snyad byed pa de bzhin du rang gi ngo bor gyur ba'i sngon po la sogs pa rig pa na sngon
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni de dang 'dra ba'o // dper na tsi tra aang ga dang sna tshogs brtson 'grus las gang yang rung ba zhig mthong ba ni gzhan la bdag gis rig go zhes bya bar tha snyad byed pa de bzhin du rang gi ngo bor gyur ba'i sngon po la sogs pa rig pa na sngon
translated: Its nature is similar to that.üîΩFor example, when one sees either CitrƒÅ·πÖga or Vi≈õƒÅkha, one uses the expression, ‚ÄúI have seen the other.‚Äù

original: po la sogs pa tha snyad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: po la sogs pa tha snyad byed pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, when one is aware of blue, which is of the nature of itself, one uses the expression ‚Äúblue.‚Äù

original: de'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba gzhan rig pa na'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba gzhan rig pa na'o //
translated: The definition is that which is similar to that, when there is awareness of the other.

original: de la zhes bya ba phyi rol don la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba phyi rol don la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù refers to the external object.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo sngon po las gzhan pa'i sngon po de zhes bya ba gsal bzhin pa'i sngon po'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo sngon po las gzhan pa'i sngon po de zhes bya ba gsal bzhin pa'i sngon po'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù refers to the blue that is different from the nature of blue, that is, the manifest blue.

original: 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang rig pa gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sngon po dang rig pa gnyis kyis so //
translated: ‚Äú By this alone‚Äù refers to both the blue and the awareness.

original: gal te phyi don du smra ba la sngon po tha dad par rig pa yang ji ltar snyam na /
analyzed: gal te phyi don du smra ba la sngon po tha dad par rig pa yang ji ltar snyam na /
translated: If you think that for the proponents of external objects, how is it that blue is cognized as different,

original: sngon po la sogs pa lkog tu zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa lkog tu zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that blue and so on are hidden.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni rang gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sngon po la sogs par rig pa las so //üîΩ'dra ba don med par bya ba'i phyir 'dri ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni rang gi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i sngon po la sogs par rig pa las so // 'dra ba don med par bya ba'i phyir 'dri ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the cognition of blue and so on that is its own nature.

original: gal te 'dra ba med kyang rang rig par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba med kyang rang rig par 'gyur na /
translated: The question is asked to show the pointlessness of similarity: If it is not similar, but is reflexive awareness,

original: de'i tshe de ltar gyur pa zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de ltar gyur pa zhig na /
translated: then at that time, it would be like that.

original: 'on kyang gang la yang rang rig pa yod pa de la ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang la yang rang rig pa yod pa de la ni /
translated: But if it is reflexive awareness, then it is similar to that.üîΩTherefore, since it is awareness from similarity, what is the point of similarity?

original: 'dra ba de rang yod pa des na 'dra ba las rig pa yin no zhes brjod pa des na 'dra bas ci bya zhes ci ste brjod snyam na 'di la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dra ba de rang yod pa des na 'dra ba las rig pa yin no zhes brjod pa des na 'dra bas ci bya zhes ci ste brjod snyam na 'di la brjod pa ni /
translated: If you think that, then the response is:

original: de ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is not so.

original: 'dra ba med na rang rig pa des don rig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba med na rang rig pa des don rig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no similarity, then that reflexive awareness does not cognize objects.

original: des na 'dra ba nyid la rig par brjod ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'dra ba nyid la rig par brjod ba yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the object is known by what is similar to it.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is ‚ÄúThat is also not tenable.‚Äù

original: 'on shes pa nyid kyis khyad @313b par 'phags pa des na don nyid du mi 'gyur ro snyam na shes pa nyid kyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on shes pa nyid kyis khyad @313b par 'phags pa des na don nyid du mi 'gyur ro snyam na shes pa nyid kyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: If you think that the object is not known by consciousness itself, but by what is superior to consciousness, then the response is ‚ÄúBy consciousness itself.‚Äù

original: sngon po mtha' dag ces bya ba ni yul dang dus gzhan na gnas pa'i sngon po yang rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon po mtha' dag ces bya ba ni yul dang dus gzhan na gnas pa'i sngon po yang rig par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúAll blue‚Äù means that even blue that exists in a different place and time is known.

original: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of what is realized is the same as the nature of what is not realized.

original: 'o na ji ltar rig par 'gyur snyam na de'i rang bzhin zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rig par 'gyur snyam na de'i rang bzhin zhes smos so //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúHow is it known?‚Äù the response is ‚ÄúBy its nature.‚Äù

original: 'dra ba de las skyes pa dag kho nas rig par byed pa tha snyad byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba de las skyes pa dag kho nas rig par byed pa tha snyad byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that what is similar to it is known by what is produced from that alone, and that is the convention.

original: gzhan yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is seen.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni mtshe ma dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni mtshe ma dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated by ‚Äútwins.‚Äù

original: shes pa phyi ma rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni shes pa snga ma dang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa phyi ma rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni shes pa snga ma dang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: The subsequent cognition is similar to the prior cognition in that it has the nature of realizing.

original: de ltar na yang nyams su myong ba yang rig bar thal lo //
analyzed: de ltar na yang nyams su myong ba yang rig bar thal lo //
translated: Thus, it follows, absurdly, that experience is also cognized.

original: ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa nye bar 'jog par byed pa can yin pa de bzhin du myong ba yang nye bar 'jog par byed pa can du brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa nye bar 'jog par byed pa can yin pa de bzhin du myong ba yang nye bar 'jog par byed pa can du brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as the prior cognition is the appropriator of the blue, etc., so too must experience be the appropriator.

original: des na nyams su myong ba'i 'dod pa nyid pa des na ji ltar thal ba yin snyam na /
analyzed: des na nyams su myong ba'i 'dod pa nyid pa des na ji ltar thal ba yin snyam na /
translated: If you accept the original premise, then how can you claim that it is not the case that the object is cognized?

original: de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is not so.

original: de dang 'dra bar sngon po la sogs pa la yang nye bar 'jog par byed pa tha dad pa brtags pa ni rig pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar sngon po la sogs pa la yang nye bar 'jog par byed pa tha dad pa brtags pa ni rig pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to impute a separate appropriator of the blue, etc., that is similar to that.

original: nyams su myong ba nyid nye bar 'jog par byed par brtags pas chog mod /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba nyid nye bar 'jog par byed par brtags pas chog mod /
translated: It is sufficient to impute the experience as the appropriator.

original: don brtags pas ci bya zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: don brtags pas ci bya zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: What is the use of imputing the object?

original: de la zhes bya ba skra shad la sogs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba skra shad la sogs par snang ba'o //
translated: In that regard, the appearance of the hairs, etc.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni ka ba la sogs par snang ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni ka ba la sogs par snang ba la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEverywhere‚Äù means that it appears as pillars and so on.

original: de bzhin du phyi'i don med par ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi'i don med par ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di skyes pa yin te /
translated: Likewise, this cognition of pillars and so on arises without external objects,

original: skra shad la sogs par snang ba dang mtshungs pa'i phyir dang mi slu ba la sogs pa yang sun phyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs par snang ba dang mtshungs pa'i phyir dang mi slu ba la sogs pa yang sun phyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar to the appearance of floating hairs and so on, and because the nondeceptive and so on have been refuted.

original: 'o na 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can de song ste /
analyzed: 'o na 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can de song ste /
translated: Well then, it is contradictory that it is nonerroneous and that it goes.

original: sngar gyi ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin la skra shad du snang ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ni dmigs pa med pa yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: sngar gyi ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin la skra shad du snang ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ni dmigs pa med pa yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: Because it is similar to the previous cognition of pillars and so on, it has an observed object, and because it is similar to the appearance of floating hairs and so on, it is without an observed object.

original: 'gal ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gal ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is contradictory.

original: 'brel pa gzung ba med pa nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa gzung ba med pa nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the apprehended object is not related?

original: don ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because the object.

original: 'o na nyams su myong ba la yang nye bar 'jog par byed pa ji ltar rtog ste /
analyzed: 'o na nyams su myong ba la yang nye bar 'jog par byed pa ji ltar rtog ste /
translated: Well then, how do you posit experience?

original: de yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam na mthong ba snga ma ni zhes gsungs so //üîΩ'on te don yang sngar gyi ka ba la sogs pa'i @314a * //
analyzed: de yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam na mthong ba snga ma ni zhes gsungs so // 'on te don yang sngar gyi ka ba la sogs pa'i @314a * //
translated: If you think that because it is not seen, it is not seen, then it is said, ‚ÄúThe previous seeing . . .‚Äù

original: shes pas dmigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: shes pas dmigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if you think that the object is not observed by the previous consciousness of the pillar, etc.,

original: des na de yang brtag go zhe na /
analyzed: des na de yang brtag go zhe na /
translated: then it should be investigated.

original: don zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe object . . .‚Äù

original: rnam pa gzhan yin na zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sngon po'i rnam par shes pa'i rjes thogs su sngon po'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa de'i tshe re zhig 'di 'gyur mod /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yin na zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe sngon po'i rnam par shes pa'i rjes thogs su sngon po'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa de'i tshe re zhig 'di 'gyur mod /
translated: If it is different, then when the consciousness of blue arises immediately after the consciousness of blue, then this is certainly the case.

original: gang gi ser por shes pa de skye ba de'i tshe nye bar 'jog pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi ser por shes pa de skye ba de'i tshe nye bar 'jog pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: But when the consciousness of yellow arises, what is it that is present?

original: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not a refutation.

original: 'dis ni 'dir bar du chod pa nyid kyis sngon po'i shes pa nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dir bar du chod pa nyid kyis sngon po'i shes pa nye bar 'jog par byed pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that the consciousness of blue is present here because it is uninterrupted.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten don myong bar 'gyur zhes nges pa de bzhin du nyams su myong ba nyams su myong ngo zhes nges pa de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten don myong bar 'gyur zhes nges pa de bzhin du nyams su myong ba nyams su myong ngo zhes nges pa de ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as one is certain that one will experience the world, one is not certain that one experiences what is experienced.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu nges pa ma mthong ba'i phyir myong ba nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu nges pa ma mthong ba'i phyir myong ba nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the result is not certain, one does not experience what is experienced.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni myong ba yang nges bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni myong ba yang nges bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means that experience is also uncertain.

original: la lar zhes bya ba smig rgyu la sogs pa nyams su myong ba la yang chu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'khrul ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la lar zhes bya ba smig rgyu la sogs pa nyams su myong ba la yang chu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'khrul ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn some cases‚Äù means that in the experience of a mirage, etc., one sees the error of taking it to be water, etc.

original: des na shes pa nyams su myong ba yang 'khrul bas nges par mi 'gyur bas ji ltar na nges pa med pas myong ba med par 'grub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na shes pa nyams su myong ba yang 'khrul bas nges par mi 'gyur bas ji ltar na nges pa med pas myong ba med par 'grub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, since the experience of consciousness is also uncertain due to error, how can one establish that there is no experience due to the uncertainty? This is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu la sogs pa'i don myong ba yod kyang nges pa med pa dang rmi lam la sogs par don de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu la sogs pa'i don myong ba yod kyang nges pa med pa dang rmi lam la sogs par don de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, although there is an experience of the object, such as a mirage, there is no ascertainment, and although the object does not exist in a dream, etc., it does exist.

original: de kho na zhes bya ba don nyams su myong bar gnas /
analyzed: de kho na zhes bya ba don nyams su myong bar gnas /
translated: The reality of that is the experience of the object.

original: 'on te 'di ni nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bya bar yang ji ltar rnam par gzhag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni nyams su myong ba yin no zhes bya bar yang ji ltar rnam par gzhag par bya ba ste /
translated: But how can it be established that this is an experience?

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is no ascertainment.

original: nyams su myong ba zhes gsungs so /'on te nges pa med pa nyid kyis nyams su myong ba ni med do zhes nges par byed na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba zhes gsungs so /'on te nges pa med pa nyid kyis nyams su myong ba ni med do zhes nges par byed na /
translated: If one ascertains that there is no experience because there is no ascertainment,üîΩthen this is said:

original: 'di la brjod pa ni rgyu zhes smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni rgyu zhes smra ba'o //
translated: The cause is said to be the experience.

original: myong ba med bar zhas bya ba ni myong ba snga ma'i myong ba gang yin pa de med par ro //
analyzed: myong ba med bar zhas bya ba ni myong ba snga ma'i myong ba gang yin pa de med par ro //
translated: Without experience, that is, without the experience of the previous experience,

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni nges pa med pas na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni nges pa med pas na'o //
translated: thus, because there is no ascertainment,

original: myong ba'i rang bzhin ni snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: myong ba'i rang bzhin ni snang ba ma yin te /
translated: the nature of experience is not appearance.

original: des 'di la brtag pa ci yod snyam na ;
analyzed: des 'di la brtag pa ci yod snyam na ;
translated: What is there to investigate in this?

original: don yod pa tsam ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: don yod pa tsam ni zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is merely the existence of the object.‚Äù

original: gal te mthong ba de lhag pa nyid du 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba de lhag pa nyid du 'gyur mod /
translated: If seeing is merely the excess of light,

original: de ltar na yang gzhan snang ba ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gzhan snang ba ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: then it is not the appearance of something else.

original: gal te zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf that is so.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba zhes bya bar grags par don mthong ba ni'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba zhes bya bar grags par don mthong ba ni'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the nature of consciousness, which is known as ‚Äúillumination.‚Äù

original: dkar po la sos pa mngon par @314b gsal ba'i sgras ci zhig brjod par bya snyam na /
analyzed: dkar po la sos pa mngon par @314b gsal ba'i sgras ci zhig brjod par bya snyam na /
translated: What is the meaning of the word ‚Äúmanifest‚Äù in ‚Äúthe manifestation of white and so on‚Äù?

original: khyed kyis zhes smos te /
analyzed: khyed kyis zhes smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúYou say.‚Äù

original: bram ze dang rigs pa can la sogs pas 'dod pa shes pa phyi ma don gyis go ba la sogs pa'i sgras byed can no //
analyzed: bram ze dang rigs pa can la sogs pas 'dod pa shes pa phyi ma don gyis go ba la sogs pa'i sgras byed can no //
translated: The word ‚Äúsay‚Äù refers to the assertion of the Brahmins, logicians, and so on that the object of knowledge is the manifestation of the object.

original: las nyid la rnam par brtag pa byas nas sun 'byin pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: las nyid la rnam par brtag pa byas nas sun 'byin pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having analyzed the action, he says, ‚ÄúIf that is so.‚Äù

original: gal te don tsam las lhag pa las yin na de yang rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te don tsam las lhag pa las yin na de yang rtogs pa yin no //
translated: If the action is the excess of light, then that is the object of knowledge.

original: las de la yang rtogs pa gzhan yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: las de la yang rtogs pa gzhan yod par 'gyur la /
translated: If that action is the object of knowledge, then there would be another object of knowledge in that action.

original: rtogs pa des yang las gzhan yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa des yang las gzhan yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And by that cognition, there would be another action.

original: de las rtogs pa min pa'i phyir thug pa med do //
analyzed: de las rtogs pa min pa'i phyir thug pa med do //
translated: And because of that, there would be an infinite regress of cognitions.

original: ji ltar sgron ma la sogs pa las ma dang su gsal ba yin pa de bzhin du don gyis gsal ba ni de 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sgron ma la sogs pa las ma dang su gsal ba yin pa de bzhin du don gyis gsal ba ni de 'dra ba ma yin no //
translated: But a lamp, etc. are not like that, in that they manifest themselves and other things.

original: gal te nge zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te nge zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that it is like a lamp, etc.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis gsal ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis gsal ba'o //
translated: It is not like that, because it is manifested by a cognition that has the nature of self-awareness.

original: thams cad gsal bar thal ba ni rang gi ngo bo tsam yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad gsal bar thal ba ni rang gi ngo bo tsam yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that it follows that everything is manifested, because it has its own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gsal ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bo tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gsal ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bo tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: The manifestation is of a particular own nature, not of mere own nature.

original: khyad par de yang thams cad la med pa des na thams cad gsal ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par de yang thams cad la med pa des na thams cad gsal ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: And that particularity does not exist for everything, so not everything is manifested.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni shes pa gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni shes pa gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúBy another cognition.‚Äù

original: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba shes pa gzhan kho nas rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gsal bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ces bya ba shes pa gzhan kho nas rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gsal bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: ‚ÄúBy another cognition alone, the particularity of its own nature is manifested.‚Äù

original: 'di la brjod pa ni 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThis is expressed‚Äù is the second expression.

original: rgyu gang zhes gsal ba gnyis pa gzhan da mi rtogs pa de'i phyir gsal ba snga ma'i rang gi ngo bo nyid gsal bar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu gang zhes gsal ba gnyis pa gzhan da mi rtogs pa de'i phyir gsal ba snga ma'i rang gi ngo bo nyid gsal bar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Since the other is not understood, therefore the nature of the first expression must be accepted as being expressed.

original: 'on te gsal ba gnyis gzhan kho nas gsal ba dang po'i rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed na de'i tshe gsal ba dang po'i rang gi ngo bo de yang gzhan gsal ba pha rol po gnyis pas gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba gnyis gzhan kho nas gsal ba dang po'i rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed na de'i tshe gsal ba dang po'i rang gi ngo bo de yang gzhan gsal ba pha rol po gnyis pas gsal ba yin na /
translated: But if the second expression, which is completely different from the first, expresses the nature of the first expression, then the nature of the first expression would be expressed by the second expression, which is completely different from the first.

original: gsal ba gnyis pa gzhan de yang mi rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsal ba gnyis pa gzhan de yang mi rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: But since the second expression, which is completely different from the first, is not understood,

original: der gzhan khas blang dgos pa thug pa med do //
analyzed: der gzhan khas blang dgos pa thug pa med do //
translated: then it would follow that there would be an infinite regress of accepting other expressions.

original: ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba gsal ba ma yin pa las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba gsal ba ma yin pa las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot understood‚Äù is the opposite of ‚Äúexpressed.‚Äù

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba gsal ba ma yin pa las bzlog par rtogs par khas len na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba gsal ba ma yin pa las bzlog par rtogs par khas len na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is so‚Äù means if you accept that the opposite of ‚Äúnot expressed‚Äù is understood.

original: 'o na de dag gis ji ltar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na de dag gis ji ltar 'dod ce na /
translated: But what do they assert?

original: khyed ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyed ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúYou‚Äù refers to the opponent.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam du don rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam du don rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as means that the object is understood merely in terms of worldly convention.

original: tha snyad yin gyi dang dam par ni ma yin pa ni de ltar ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: tha snyad yin gyi dang dam par ni ma yin pa ni de ltar ni bshad zin to //
translated: It is a convention, not in the ultimate sense, as has already been explained.

original: des na khyed kyi lta ba la don 'de mthong ngo snyam pa 'di ja ltar @315a * //
analyzed: des na khyed kyi lta ba la don 'de mthong ngo snyam pa 'di ja ltar @315a * //
translated: Therefore, how is it that you see this object?

original: zhes nged kyis dris pa de ni rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: zhes nged kyis dris pa de ni rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: This question of ours is quite reasonable.

original: gal te khyed la yang don med ba'i phyir na don 'di mthong ngo zhes ji ltar nges she na /
analyzed: gal te khyed la yang don med ba'i phyir na don 'di mthong ngo zhes ji ltar nges she na /
translated: If, for you, there is no object, how is it ascertained that this object is seen?

original: nged kyi ltar na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nged kyi ltar na zhes gsungs so //
translated: We say, according to us.

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba shes pa'i de lta bur gyur pa ste don dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba shes pa'i de lta bur gyur pa ste don dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: This refers to the cognition, which is of that kind, i.e., similar to the object.

original: 'dis ni ba rol bos 'dra ba la ni log par rtogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'dis ni ba rol bos 'dra ba la ni log par rtogs pa ma yin /
translated: This shows that similarity is not a misconception,

original: 'on kyang rang rig pa la'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang rig pa la'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: but rather self-awareness.

original: de las gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni dbyig pa dang skyes bu dag las tha dad pa'i rig pas so //
analyzed: de las gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni dbyig pa dang skyes bu dag las tha dad pa'i rig pas so //
translated: By other than that, it means by an awareness that is distinct from the stick and the person.

original: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dbugs dang bcas pa'i skyes bu'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dbugs dang bcas pa'i skyes bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù refers to a person who has breath.

original: 'di nyid las gzhan gyis bsam pa brjod pas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid las gzhan gyis bsam pa brjod pas gsungs pa ni /
translated: The author of the treatise states his own opinion:

original: rang rig pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pas ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy itself‚Äù means by the self-awareness.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni khyed kyi zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni khyed kyi zhes bya ba'o // de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the object.

original: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi rnam pa'o //üîΩdon de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can gyi rnam pa'o // don de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù refers to the form of the object and the form of the cognition.

original: khyad par dang khyad par can du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par dang khyad par can du gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis kind of object‚Äù refers to the object and the cognition.

original: 'on te de'i zhes bya ba don dang 'dra ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'on te de'i zhes bya ba don dang 'dra ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOr that‚Äù refers to the nature of the object that is similar to the cognition.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBy another‚Äù refers to the second cognition.

original: shes pa gnyis pas don dang 'dra ba'i shes pa de'i rang bzhin du don dang 'dra ba'i mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa dang rnam pa mtshungs par ro //
analyzed: shes pa gnyis pas don dang 'dra ba'i shes pa de'i rang bzhin du don dang 'dra ba'i mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa dang rnam pa mtshungs par ro //
translated: The nature of the cognition that is similar to the object is the form of the cognition that is similar to the object.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the object.üîΩ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the cognition.

original: re zhig dang po ni mthong ba ni khyad par med pa ni don nyid rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dang po ni mthong ba ni khyad par med pa ni don nyid rtogs pa yin te /
translated: First, the non-distinction of seeing is the realization of the object itself.

original: mthong ba ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because seeing is not a realization.

original: gzhan gyis ni shes pa gnyis pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni shes pa gnyis pas so //
translated: The other is by the two cognitions.

original: ci ltar rtogs zhes bya ba ni gcig 'khrul bar thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci ltar rtogs zhes bya ba ni gcig 'khrul bar thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How is there realization? It means that it follows that one is mistaken.

original: 'on te gcig gi tshe nyid mthong ba'i khyad bar can dang / khyad par med pa rtogs pa de'i tshe nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'on te gcig gi tshe nyid mthong ba'i khyad bar can dang / khyad par med pa rtogs pa de'i tshe nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If, at the time of seeing, there is realization of the distinction and non-distinction of one, then this fault would occur.

original: 'on kyang dang po ni khyad par med par rtogs la phyis ni khyad par can du yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dang po ni khyad par med par rtogs la phyis ni khyad par can du yin te /
translated: However, first there is realization without distinction, and later with distinction.

original: dper na dang bo'i skyes bu'i dbyig pas khyad par du ma byas par rtogs la /
analyzed: dper na dang bo'i skyes bu'i dbyig pas khyad par du ma byas par rtogs la /
translated: For example, first a person is realized without distinction by a stick.

original: phyis ni des khyad par du byas 'dzin bzhin no //
analyzed: phyis ni des khyad par du byas 'dzin bzhin no //
translated: Later, it is grasped as distinguished by that.

original: des nyes pa ci yod du bsams nas pha rol po brjod pa ni 'on te phyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des nyes pa ci yod du bsams nas pha rol po brjod pa ni 'on te phyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thinking about what fault there is in that, the opponent says, But later...

original: sun 'byin pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation is That also...

original: shes pa dang po de ni phyis sems gzhan gyis don gyi rig pa yin na /
analyzed: shes pa dang po de ni phyis sems gzhan gyis don gyi rig pa yin na /
translated: The first cognition is the cognition of the object by the subsequent mind.

original: sems dang po de don gyi rnam pa nyid yin mod /üîΩgzhal bya don gyi khyad par can nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems dang po de don gyi rnam pa nyid yin mod / gzhal bya don gyi khyad par can nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The first mind is the aspect of the object,üîΩbut it is not the object itself, the particular thing to be cognized.

original: mthong ba des ni don da rang gis khyad par du byas @315b pa nyid du ni rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba des ni don da rang gis khyad par du byas @315b pa nyid du ni rig pa ma yin no //
translated: That seeing does not cognize the object as qualified by itself.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod ci skyon snyam na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: de lta min pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta min pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is not like that.

original: gzhan ni shes pa gnyis pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni shes pa gnyis pa'i dus na'o //
translated: The other is at the time of the second cognition.

original: de'i tshe 'dir bden ba gang yin pa de 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dir bden ba gang yin pa de 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: At that time, there is no truth here at all.

original: 'ba' zhig dang 'ba' zhig pa nyid du gyur ba'i don dang shes pa dag ni'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig dang 'ba' zhig pa nyid du gyur ba'i don dang shes pa dag ni'o //
translated: The object and cognition that are solely and only so

original: don rtogs pa'i dus su ni /üîΩde'i shes pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: don rtogs pa'i dus su ni / de'i shes pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir la /
translated: are not cognized at the time of realizing the object.üîΩBecause at the time of realizing the object, its cognition is not realized,

original: shes pa rtogs pa med pa'i dus na yang don ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rtogs pa med pa'i dus na yang don ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and at the time of realizing the cognition, it is not the object.

original: de'i shes pa'i dus na don sgro btags nas de ltar rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i shes pa'i dus na don sgro btags nas de ltar rtogs pa yin no zhe na /

original: gnyi gar yang zhes bya ba ni de las skyes pa dang de snang bar phyed snga ma 'grel pa ni khas blangs pas ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnyi gar yang zhes bya ba ni de las skyes pa dang de snang bar phyed snga ma 'grel pa ni khas blangs pas ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBoth‚Äù means that it is half-perceived as arisen from that and as appearing as that. The first interpretation is ‚Äúby the admission‚Äù of the opponent.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid des rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyis na'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid des rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyis na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that very nature‚Äù means that it is understood by that very nature.

original: 'di nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'chad bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'chad bzhin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis very‚Äù means that which is being explained.

original: rtags las skye bar zhes bya ba ni yul du gyur pa'i gzhan gyi bde ba las dngos su skye bar 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags las skye bar zhes bya ba ni yul du gyur pa'i gzhan gyi bde ba las dngos su skye bar 'gog pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from a sign‚Äù means that it is directly arisen from the object, the pleasure of another.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection to this is ‚ÄúIn that case . . . ‚Äù

original: spyi zhes bya ba ni bde ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba ni bde ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúGeneral‚Äù means that it is pleasure itself.

original: de'i zhes bya ba yul gyi rnam pas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba yul gyi rnam pas stong pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the object, which is empty.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa yin na ji ltar rang rig pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa yin na ji ltar rang rig pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is an inference, how can it be self-awareness?

original: gal te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba smos so //

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba mi gsal ba nyid du snang ba'i rnam pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba mi gsal ba nyid du snang ba'i rnam pa la'o //

original: de la zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the nature of the unclear.

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan gyis ma rig pa de lta na yang de ni de nyid kyi yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan gyis ma rig pa de lta na yang de ni de nyid kyi yin no zhe na /

original: gzhan gyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another‚Äù is stated.

original: 'on te chod pa dang ma zad pa la sogs pas gzhan gyis mtshor ba yin no zhe na de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te chod pa dang ma zad pa la sogs pas gzhan gyis mtshor ba yin no zhe na de la zhes bya ba'o //

original: 'on te bar chad la sogs pa srid pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bar chad la sogs pa srid pa kho na'o zhe na /

analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba gsungs so //

original: de dang ni gzhan dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang ni gzhan dang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is that and another.

original: de ni gzhan dang 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: de ni gzhan dang 'bral ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is being separated from another.

original: gal te rgyal po'i bka' lung gi dbang gis de skad smra na smras mod /
analyzed: gal te rgyal po'i bka' lung gi dbang gis de skad smra na smras mod /
translated: If it is said that way by the power of the king‚Äôs command, it is said.

original: 'on kyang tha snyad ni gang du yang de ltar ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha snyad ni gang du yang de ltar ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, the convention is not seen in that way anywhere.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs.

original: @317b gal te gzhan gyis bde ba'i rang bzhin de nyid rtogs na de'i tshe de yang bde bar 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: @317b gal te gzhan gyis bde ba'i rang bzhin de nyid rtogs na de'i tshe de yang bde bar 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
translated: If you fear that if others understand that nature of pleasure, then they too will be happy,

original: de lta na yang zhes smras so //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes smras so //
translated: then it is said, ‚ÄúEven so. . . .‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pas bde ba spyad pas ni bde bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas bde ba spyad pas ni bde bar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with ‚Äúone does not become happy through the experience of pleasure by inference.‚Äù

original: shes pa rnam pa mtshungs pa can dag la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa de dag las yin /
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa mtshungs pa can dag la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa de dag las yin /
translated: In the case of cognitions that have the same aspect, there is a difference in the characteristics of perception and inference.

original: rang gi zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own‚Äù is explained as ‚Äúone‚Äôs own nature.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúEven so‚Äù means ‚Äúnevertheless.‚Äù

original: 'o na rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /

original: gnyi ga'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i zhes gsungs so //

original: mthong ngo zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu tha dad par ro //
analyzed: mthong ngo zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu tha dad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOne sees‚Äù means that there is a difference in their causes.

original: rang gi brjod pa ni rang gi ngo bo'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi brjod pa ni rang gi ngo bo'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own expression‚Äù is one‚Äôs own nature.

original: des na zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of a difference in their own natures.

original: sogs pa'i sgra'i gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra'i gsungs pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the following passage:

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is just as if‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: don gcig ldan zhes bya ba ni bshad pa ni don gcig la zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde nyid gang la 'debs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gcig ldan zhes bya ba ni bshad pa ni don gcig la zhes bya ba'o // de nyid gang la 'debs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving the same object‚Äù means ‚Äúhaving the same object of understanding.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthat very thing‚Äù refers to the ‚Äúthat very thing‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthat very thing is not seen.‚Äù

original: de lta bu dang de lta bu ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bu dang de lta bu ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid 'chad pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that way and not in that way‚Äù is explained in the following passage:

original: gzhan gyi bde ba nyid rtogs pa na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bde ba nyid rtogs pa na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen one realizes the happiness of another,

original: sdug bsngal la sogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes so //
translated: one‚Äôs own suffering and so on is transformed.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i nyes pa yod pa'i gtan tshigs des na mngon sum las rjes su dpag pa tha dang par ram /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i nyes pa yod pa'i gtan tshigs des na mngon sum las rjes su dpag pa tha dang par ram /

original: ma mthong ba des mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa tha dad par mi rigs so //
analyzed: ma mthong ba des mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa tha dad par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to maintain that direct perception and inference are different on the ground that one is not seen and the other is seen.

original: 'di yang ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is also the case with pleasure and pain, and so on.

original: des na khyed kyi 'di ni mi 'dod pa thog tu bab pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: des na khyed kyi 'di ni mi 'dod pa thog tu bab pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //

original: 'gyur mod ces bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'gyur mod ces bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni yang ma mthong ba'i dbang gis yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni yang ma mthong ba'i dbang gis yin no //
translated: The pleasure, etc., are not seen because of the absence of the object.

original: 'di kho bo mi rtsod kyi 'on kyang rang rig pa dang rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang ma mthong ba nyid kyi dbang gis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di kho bo mi rtsod kyi 'on kyang rang rig pa dang rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang ma mthong ba nyid kyi dbang gis 'grub par 'gyur ro //

original: de las te dang po gsal bar mthong ba las mngon sum nyid du gnas kyi dbang po las skyes pa nyid kyis ni 'jig rten mngon sum nyid du nges pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de las te dang po gsal bar mthong ba las mngon sum nyid du gnas kyi dbang po las skyes pa nyid kyis ni 'jig rten mngon sum nyid du nges pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: From that, i.e., from the first clear seeing, the self-awareness and the presence of the aspects are established as direct perception, not because of being born from the sense faculties.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bdag gis mi gsal bar rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum las ma yin no zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gis mi gsal bar rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum las ma yin no zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood that what is understood by me as unclear is not from direct perception.

original: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second half is explained: ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is the reason.

original: 'das ma thag pa nyid @318a * //
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa nyid @318a * //
translated: The immediately past is

original: pha rol po ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol po ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the teacher of the opponent, ‚Äúthus‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs statement.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba dang gsal ba dang dbang po med pa'i phyir na yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / nye bar rig pa gnyis po ni ji ltar yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba dang gsal ba dang dbang po med pa'i phyir na yang dag par 'dzin pa dang / nye bar rig pa gnyis po ni ji ltar yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the non-existence of the two, the manifest and the sense faculty, the two, apprehension and awareness, are not possible in any way.

original: de'i zhes bya ba mngon sum gyi yan lag nye bar gnas pa rig pa nyid rjes su dpag pa la ma tshang ba'i phyir la yang mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba mngon sum gyi yan lag nye bar gnas pa rig pa nyid rjes su dpag pa la ma tshang ba'i phyir la yang mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the non-existence of the direct perception limb, the awareness itself, in inference, inference would not be direct perception.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni ring po dang ring po ma yin pa mthong ba dag gi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni ring po dang ring po ma yin pa mthong ba dag gi'o //
translated: Theirs, i.e., of the seeing of long and short, etc.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni ring po mthong ba bya rgol la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni ring po mthong ba bya rgol la sogs pa'o //
translated: That, i.e., the seeing of long, is the opponent, etc.

original: de nyid de ring na 'dug pa'i dngos po nyid gsal ba'i phyir thag ring po ma yin no zhes brjod par byed de /
analyzed: de nyid de ring na 'dug pa'i dngos po nyid gsal ba'i phyir thag ring po ma yin no zhes brjod par byed de /
translated: He says that it is not long because of the clarity of the very thing that is situated at a distance.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po'i nus pa gang yin pa de la ltos nas ring po dang ring po ma yin pa ram par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po'i nus pa gang yin pa de la ltos nas ring po dang ring po ma yin pa ram par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-existence of the sense faculty‚Äôs capacity, long and short are situated at a distance.

original: gang la dbang po'i shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa yod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la dbang po'i shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pa yod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: that is, it is the capacity to generate a sense consciousness.

original: de yang zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa yang rnam pa med pa kho nar zad mod /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa yang rnam pa med pa kho nar zad mod /
translated: And that consciousness is also devoid of aspects.

original: da ni grub pa'i mtha' gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: da ni grub pa'i mtha' gsungs pa ni /
translated: Now the tenets are stated:

original: de ni mi rung ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is not correct.

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa las so //üîΩde yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa las so // de yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa yang ngo //
translated: Others, by inference.üîΩAnd that, by inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa de yang rtags las 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de yang rtags las 'jug pa yin no //

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i shes pa dang 'brel pa dang ldan pa gzhan ni med de /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i shes pa dang 'brel pa dang ldan pa gzhan ni med de /

original: des dbang po la sogs pa kho na rtags yin no //
analyzed: des dbang po la sogs pa kho na rtags yin no //

original: gal te de ni don gyis go bas dpog par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de ni don gyis go bas dpog par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: If that is asserted to be inferred by implication,

original: don gyis go ba de ni 'brel pa mthong ba nyid las ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyis go ba de ni 'brel pa mthong ba nyid las ma yin no //

original: des na yid la byed pa'i mthar thug pa rnams las gzhan kho na zhig rtags su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na yid la byed pa'i mthar thug pa rnams las gzhan kho na zhig rtags su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, something other than the final mental activity would be the reason.

original: don gyis go ba yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don gyis go ba yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The meaning is: ‚Äúin fact, it is understood.‚Äù

original: gzhan du ni shes pa med par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni shes pa med par ro //
translated: Otherwise, i.e., if there is no cognition,

original: 'on te nus pa'i rgyu mthong ba las 'bras bu rjes su dpog na de'i tshe de ji ltar 'khrul snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te nus pa'i rgyu mthong ba las 'bras bu rjes su dpog na de'i tshe de ji ltar 'khrul snyam na /
translated: If, on the other hand, you infer the effect from the perception of the cause of the potentiality, then how can that be mistaken?

original: nus pa yod ces smos so //
analyzed: nus pa yod ces smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe potentiality exists.‚Äù

original: dbang po gang la rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu mthong ba yod pa ma yin pa de mtha'i skad cig nyid thob par ji ltar nges don kyang de bzhin du rtags ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: dbang po gang la rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu mthong ba yod pa ma yin pa de mtha'i skad cig nyid thob par ji ltar nges don kyang de bzhin du rtags ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: How can it be ascertained that the sense faculty, in the absence of the effect characterized by consciousness, has attained the final moment? The meaning is: the reason is not so.

analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa phyi ma'i dus su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt another time‚Äù means at the time of the subsequent consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi @318b ri khrod rjes bshad pa yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi @318b ri khrod rjes bshad pa yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: This is the explanation of the same point.

original: rjes su dpag pa las zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i don gzhan du mi 'thad pa las so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i don gzhan du mi 'thad pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom inference‚Äù means from the fact that the manifestation of another object is not tenable.

original: gcig gi tshe zhes bya ba ni gsal ba nyid rtags su khas blangs pa na'o //
analyzed: gcig gi tshe zhes bya ba ni gsal ba nyid rtags su khas blangs pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt one time‚Äù means when manifestation itself is accepted as the reason.

original: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni gsal bar gyur ba rtags su khas len pa na'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni gsal bar gyur ba rtags su khas len pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe life of another‚Äù means that the manifestation is accepted as the reason.

original: gsal ba ma shes na gsal bar gyur pa mi nges pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gsal ba ma shes na gsal bar gyur pa mi nges pa'i phyir te /
translated: If the manifestation is not known, the manifestation is not ascertained,

original: dbyig pa ma rtogs par dbyig pa can du mi rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyig pa ma rtogs par dbyig pa can du mi rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just as if the stick is not understood, the stick-holder is not understood.

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis gsal ba nyams su myong ba des na gsal bar 'gyur ba'i don nges la de las shes pa rjes su dpog pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis gsal ba nyams su myong ba des na gsal bar 'gyur ba'i don nges la de las shes pa rjes su dpog pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if the manifestation is experienced by inference itself, then the meaning of the manifestation is ascertained and from that the cognition is inferred.

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes smos so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy inference‚Äù is stated.

original: 'on te gsal ba ni mngon sum nyid kyis rtogs pa des na /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba ni mngon sum nyid kyis rtogs pa des na /
translated: But if the manifestation is understood by perception itself,

original: gsal bar gyur ba'i don nges pa ni blo rjes su dpog pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gsal bar gyur ba'i don nges pa ni blo rjes su dpog pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then the ascertainment of the meaning of the manifestation is the inference of the cognition.

original: don gyi zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: don gyi zhes gsungs te /
translated: ‚ÄúOf the object‚Äù is stated.

original: de nyid blo yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid blo yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the cognition itself.

original: 'o na bya ba nyid dpag mod blo ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bya ba nyid dpag mod blo ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Well then, it is indeed the activity that is inferred, but how is the cognition?

original: bya ba yang blo yin no zhes smos so //
analyzed: bya ba yang blo yin no zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe activity is also the cognition‚Äù is stated.

original: gzhan du min zhes bya ba ni bya bas byas pa'i khyad par spangs nas ni las su 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du min zhes bya ba ni bya bas byas pa'i khyad par spangs nas ni las su 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNot otherwise‚Äù means that, having eliminated the distinction of being produced by action, it would not be an object.

original: khyad par las nyid yin no zhe na'o //
analyzed: khyad par las nyid yin no zhe na'o //
translated: If you say that it is the distinction itself,

original: de'i tshe bya ba tsam rjes su dpog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe bya ba tsam rjes su dpog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then at that time it would be inferred as mere action,

analyzed: bya ba'i khyad par du 'gyur ba'i blo ni ma yin no //

original: 'di ni bya ba khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bya ba khas blangs nas brjod pa yin no //

original: da ni bya ba nyid med do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: da ni bya ba nyid med do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Now, in saying that action itself does not exist,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said that ‚Äúfrom the nature of things.‚Äù

original: bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi mthong ba na snang bzhin pa las gzhan nam /
analyzed: bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi mthong ba na snang bzhin pa las gzhan nam /
translated: When seeing the nature of action, it is not from what is presently appearing,

original: lta ba las gzhan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba las gzhan pa ma yin no //
translated: nor from anything other than seeing.

original: gzung ba nyid du rig pa yin la /
analyzed: gzung ba nyid du rig pa yin la /

original: gzung ba mthong pa de las ni 'dzin par byed pa rjes su dpog go snyam na /
analyzed: gzung ba mthong pa de las ni 'dzin par byed pa rjes su dpog go snyam na /
translated: and from that seen object, the apprehender is inferred.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de ni mi rung ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de ni mi rung ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the response is ‚ÄúThat is not tenable.‚Äù

original: byed pa ni ngas gzung ngo zhes blos so //
analyzed: byed pa ni ngas gzung ngo zhes blos so //
translated: The agent is ‚ÄúI grasp‚Äù by the mind.

original: blo'i byed pas zhes rang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo'i byed pas zhes rang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the expression ‚Äúby the activity of the mind‚Äù is used.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni byed pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni byed pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the activity.

original: 'on te bya ba'i ming can 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mthong ba yang don las gzhan yin na /
analyzed: 'on te bya ba'i ming can 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mthong ba yang don las gzhan yin na /
translated: But if seeing, which is named after the action, is different from the object because of the characteristic of grasping,

original: de'i tshe rang bzhin gnyis su mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang bzhin gnyis su mthong bar 'gyur te /

original: mthong ba'i rang bzhin dang don gyi rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rang bzhin dang don gyi rang bzhin du'o //
translated: the nature of seeing and the nature of the object.

original: ji ltar gnas pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni don de ji ltar gnas pa de las ma 'das pas 'dzin pa tsam gyi blos byed par zad kyi don de la khyad par 'ga' zhig byed pa ni @319a * //üîΩma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni don de ji ltar gnas pa de las ma 'das pas 'dzin pa tsam gyi blos byed par zad kyi don de la khyad par 'ga' zhig byed pa ni @319a * // ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAs it exists‚Äù means that the mind, which is mere grasping, is limited to that object as it exists, without going beyond it. It does not make any difference to the object.

original: 'on te 'di gzung bzhin ba nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ro zhes gzung ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'on te 'di gzung bzhin ba nyid kyis khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur ro zhes gzung ba zhes smos so //
translated: But if it is said that ‚Äúgrasping‚Äù is superior because it is the act of grasping,

analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ji ltar gnas pa'i rang bzhin dang mi mthun par 'dzin na yang ngo //

analyzed: rang gi dus thams cad dang ma 'brel yang sgron ma la sogs pa bum pa la sogs pa'i gsal byed yin no //

analyzed: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa rnams ji srid gnas pa'i dus de srid pa 'brel pa ni sgron mas bum pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du shes pas kyang yin no zhe na /

analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de la'ang zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: spu ldang ba la sogs pa'i thun mong du skyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that it would be produced in common with the hairs standing on end and so on.

original: de lta'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúThat is so,‚Äù

original: thun mong du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thun mong du zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúin common.‚Äù

original: gal te bud med dang skyes pa gnyis la bde ba skyes pa des kyang thun mong du spu ldang ba la sogs pa bskyed na de'i tshe de dag gi dga' ba yang thun mong du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bud med dang skyes pa gnyis la bde ba skyes pa des kyang thun mong du spu ldang ba la sogs pa bskyed na de'i tshe de dag gi dga' ba yang thun mong du 'gyur ro //
