translated: If pleasure arises in both a woman and a man, and if it generates the common arousal of the bodily hairs, then their pleasure would be common.

original: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu tsam gyis ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba ni skyes bu tsam gyis ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, it is not just a man.

original: 'on te der bde ba der ma skyes la dbang po'i phrang ba yang med do snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te der bde ba der ma skyes la dbang po'i phrang ba yang med do snyam na /
translated: If you think that pleasure does not arise there, and that there is no contact of the sense faculties,

original: ldan pa yang ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ldan pa yang ma yin te zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is not even a possession.

original: yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not exist.üîΩThere, in regard to those two,

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba ni de gnyis gang rung la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba ni de gnyis gang rung la'o //
translated: the objection is that in regard to either of them,

original: der ni bde ba la'o //
analyzed: der ni bde ba la'o //
translated: there, in pleasure,

original: khyod la ni sangs rgyas pa la'o //
analyzed: khyod la ni sangs rgyas pa la'o //
translated: you, the Buddhist,

original: rnal 'byor ba la zhes bya ba me la sogs pa nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba la zhes bya ba me la sogs pa nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the yogi, because of the non-experience of fire, etc.

original: dogs pa bsu @320b ba ni gzhan rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa dag la me myong ba na gdung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na ma yin te zhes lan 'debs pa la'o //
analyzed: dogs pa bsu @320b ba ni gzhan rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa dag la me myong ba na gdung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na ma yin te zhes lan 'debs pa la'o //
translated: The response to the objection is: ‚ÄúNo, because they are not yogis.‚Äù

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa nyid du'o //
translated: ‚Äú Such‚Äù refers to the production of suffering.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚Äú Otherwise‚Äù refers to the nature of objectification.

original: de'i rig pa ni bde ba la sogs pa rig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rig pa ni bde ba la sogs pa rig par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Its knowledge‚Äù refers to the knowledge of pleasure, etc.

original: dmigs pa dang myong ba de gnyis la'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang myong ba de gnyis la'o //
translated: ‚Äú Those two‚Äù refers to objectification and experience.

original: de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa gnas pa'i bde ba ni de'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa gnas pa'i bde ba ni de'i rnam pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Its aspect‚Äù refers to the aspect of the pleasure of the abiding of consciousness.

original: des zhes bya ba ni rang gi sdug bsngal gyis so //üîΩrnal 'byor pa ni de lta ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bde ba'am /
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni rang gi sdug bsngal gyis so // rnal 'byor pa ni de lta ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bde ba'am /
translated: ‚Äú By that‚Äù refers to one‚Äôs own suffering.

original: des bskyed pa'i rnam bas bdag nyid du zin par mi sems pa'o //
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i rnam bas bdag nyid du zin par mi sems pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú The yogi is not like that‚Äù means that he does not think of himself as having the pleasure of another or the aspect produced by that.

original: de bzhin du ni so so skye bo bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni so so skye bo bzhin no //
translated: ‚Äú Like ordinary people‚Äù means like ordinary people.

original: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa ma yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa ma yin na'o //
translated: If it were not so, i.e., if there were no self-awareness,

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba ni shes bya ba ni shes rab la sogs rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba ni shes bya ba ni shes rab la sogs rnams so //
translated: those, i.e., the objects of knowledge such as wisdom,

original: don de yang zhes bya ba ni snang bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: don de yang zhes bya ba ni snang bzhin pa'o //
translated: that very object, i.e., the appearing object,

original: de la ni snang bzhin pa'i don la'o //
analyzed: de la ni snang bzhin pa'i don la'o //
translated: in that, i.e., in the appearing object,

original: de lta ni shes rab la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de lta ni shes rab la sogs pa la'o //
translated: that, i.e., the wisdom, etc.,

original: goms pas ni snang bzhin pa'i don mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: goms pas ni snang bzhin pa'i don mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
translated: by cultivation, i.e., by the non-manifestation of the appearing object,

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir snang ba'i don las tha dad pa yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir snang ba'i don las tha dad pa yin /
translated: because that is so, therefore, it is different from the appearing object.

original: shes rab gzhan de ni rnam pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab gzhan de ni rnam pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
translated: That other wisdom is not with aspects.

original: pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i tshig gi dogs pa bsu ba ni shes rab la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol po nyid sangs rgyas pa'i tshig gi dogs pa bsu ba ni shes rab la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent's objection is anticipated with wisdom, etc.

original: pha rol po nyid sun 'byin pa ni de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po nyid sun 'byin pa ni de ni ma yin te /
translated: The opponent's objection is refuted with that is not so.

original: srog chags thams cad la yod pa'i phyir na srog chags so so la tha dad pa de bzhin du don yang tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog chags thams cad la yod pa'i phyir na srog chags so so la tha dad pa de bzhin du don yang tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: Since it exists in all living beings, just as the meaning is different for each living being,

original: rang bzhin mthong ba las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin mthong ba las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: so too the meaning would be different, because it arises from seeing the nature.

original: rgyu tha dad pas 'bras bu yang tha dad pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pas 'bras bu yang tha dad pa ni /
translated: The result is different because of the difference in the cause.

original: rig pas thob pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rig pas thob pa yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intention: it is obtained through reasoning.

original: gzugs la sogs pa de'i khyad par skyes bu du mas nges pa'i dus na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa de'i khyad par skyes bu du mas nges pa'i dus na /
translated: When the particularities of form and so on are ascertained by many persons,

original: shes pas bskyed pa'i gzugs la sogs pa thams cad dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pas bskyed pa'i gzugs la sogs pa thams cad dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: all forms and so on produced by consciousness will be observed.

original: de na skyes bu de dag gi shes pa rang bzhin sna tshogs su snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de na skyes bu de dag gi shes pa rang bzhin sna tshogs su snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the consciousness of those persons will appear as a variety of natures.

original: gal te rang rang gi shes pas bskyed pa ni don kho na dmigs kyi //
analyzed: gal te rang rang gi shes pas bskyed pa ni don kho na dmigs kyi //
translated: If what is produced by each individual consciousness is only the object,

original: gzhan gyi shes pa bskyed pa ni ma yin pa des na rang bzhin du mar snang bar ci ltar thal snyam na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi shes pa bskyed pa ni ma yin pa des na rang bzhin du mar snang bar ci ltar thal snyam na /
translated: and what is produced by another consciousness is not, then how could it follow that it appears as a variety of natures?

original: so so rang nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: so so rang nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúEach one‚Äôs own.‚Äù

original: 'on te shes pas @321a * //
analyzed: 'on te shes pas @321a * //
translated: But if it is consciousness,

original: bskyed pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rang gi kho nas dmigs par bya ba de gal te rang gi rigs par khas len na /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rang gi kho nas dmigs par bya ba de gal te rang gi rigs par khas len na /
translated: If you accept that the form, etc. generated by the eye consciousness is perceived by the eye consciousness itself,

original: de'i tshe shes pa nyid 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa nyid 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then consciousness itself would change.

original: 'on kyang de ltar ni khas len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar ni khas len pa ma yin no //
translated: But you do not accept that.

original: 'on te ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If you ask how,

original: shes pas bskyed pa'i don de yang shes pa gzhan gyis dmigs pa yin no snyam du bsams nas pha rol po smra ba ni /
analyzed: shes pas bskyed pa'i don de yang shes pa gzhan gyis dmigs pa yin no snyam du bsams nas pha rol po smra ba ni /
translated: the opponent thinks that the object generated by consciousness is perceived by another consciousness.

original: de ste gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ste shes pa gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: de ste gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ste shes pa gzhan gyis so //
translated: ‚Äú If it is perceived by another‚Äù means by another consciousness.

original: lan 'debs pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan 'debs pa ni de ltar na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúIn that case . . . ‚Äù

original: des bskyed pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang bskyed pas so //
analyzed: des bskyed pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang bskyed pas so //
translated: ‚Äú By that which generates it‚Äù means by consciousness and what is generated.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang pos bskyed pa'i don la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang pos bskyed pa'i don la yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù means in the object generated by the first consciousness.

original: mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ri la gnas pa'i du ba mthong ba yin yang ngo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ri la gnas pa'i du ba mthong ba yin yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú Seeing‚Äù means seeing the smoke that is located on the mountain.

original: rtags de nyid las zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa nyid las so //
analyzed: rtags de nyid las zhes bya ba gzugs la sogs pa nyid las so //
translated: ‚Äú From that sign‚Äù means from form, etc.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni dpe smos na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni dpe smos na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is so‚Äù means if the example is mentioned.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bral ba nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang bral ba nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent characteristics‚Äù means freedom from conceptuality, etc.

original: 'di la yang ni rjes su dpag pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la yang ni rjes su dpag pa la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this case‚Äù means in the case of inference.

original: gal te mchan nyid tha dad pa tsam gyis mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan yin na /
analyzed: gal te mchan nyid tha dad pa tsam gyis mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan yin na /
translated: If direct perception is different from inference merely by having different characteristics,

original: rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum las gzhan yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum las gzhan yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then inference would be different from direct perception,

original: de la yang mtshan nyid tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang mtshan nyid tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it also has different characteristics.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut‚Äù means a doubt.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means a philosophical position.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: This is clarified:

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means ‚Äúif it is so.‚Äù

original: rtogs so zhe na zhes bya ba ni mdun na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs so zhe na zhes bya ba ni mdun na gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne understands‚Äù means ‚Äúone understands what is in front of oneself.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //üîΩgzhan du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid ma rtogs na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro // gzhan du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid ma rtogs na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù is applied to ‚Äúin that case, it would also be so.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means if one does not understand oneself.

original: rang nyid ces bya ba ni blo med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba ni blo med pa kho na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own‚Äù means one is simply without awareness.

original: de dang 'brel pa can zhes bya ba ni blo dang 'brel pa can te g-yo 'gul la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa can zhes bya ba ni blo dang 'brel pa can te g-yo 'gul la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRelated to that‚Äù means related to the mind, such as movement.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la blo ma rtogs par ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la blo ma rtogs par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another‚Äù means by itself, without understanding the mind.

original: rjes su dpog go zhes bya ba ni gang gi don mthong ba de ni blo dang ldan pa yin te dper na de bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpog go zhes bya ba ni gang gi don mthong ba de ni blo dang ldan pa yin te dper na de bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOne infers‚Äù means that one infers that one who sees an object has a mind, just like oneself.

original: gzhan yang don rtogs pa yin no zhes rjes dpog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan yang don rtogs pa yin no zhes rjes dpog go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, one infers that one understands an object. This is the meaning of ‚Äúone infers.‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' pas dpe nyid ma grub po zhes brjod pa ni rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' pas dpe nyid ma grub po zhes brjod pa ni rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The one who asserts the conclusion says, ‚ÄúThe example itself is not established,‚Äù referring to ‚Äúoneself.‚Äù

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni gang gis mthong ba nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni gang gis mthong ba nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means that one infers that one who sees understands.

original: don @321b gyis rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa la'o //
analyzed: don @321b gyis rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the case of inference from an object‚Äù means in the case of inference from an object.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rang dang 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mthong bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rang dang 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mthong bar gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means that which is seen by the characteristic related to oneself.

original: 'on te blo ni bdag nyid rtogs pa nyid de 'on kyang gzhan gyi yin no snyam na de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'on te blo ni bdag nyid rtogs pa nyid de 'on kyang gzhan gyi yin no snyam na de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If one thinks that the mind understands itself but not another, the text says ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: blo'i bdag nyid do thug pa med pa'i tshul bstan pa ni de la yang zhes bya ba ste shes pa gzhan la yang ngo //
analyzed: blo'i bdag nyid do thug pa med pa'i tshul bstan pa ni de la yang zhes bya ba ste shes pa gzhan la yang ngo //
translated: The demonstration of the manner of the infinite regress of cognition is ‚Äúin regard to that,‚Äù i.e., in regard to another cognition.

original: shes pa de ni mthong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: shes pa de ni mthong bar 'gyur la /
translated: That cognition is seen.

original: phyis na rtogs pa mthong bar 'gyur la de nas ni rtogs pa'i rtogs pa mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa thug pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: phyis na rtogs pa mthong bar 'gyur la de nas ni rtogs pa'i rtogs pa mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa thug pa'i tshul lo //
translated: Later, the realization is seen. Then, the realization of the realization is seen, etc. This is the manner of the infinite regress.

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni yid kyi shes pa la'o //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni yid kyi shes pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to that‚Äù refers to the mental cognition.

original: lan btab zin to zhes bya ba ni /üîΩrigs don ma yin de ldan min //
analyzed: lan btab zin to zhes bya ba ni / rigs don ma yin de ldan min //
translated: The reply has already been given,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: as in ‚ÄúThe reason is not the meaning, nor is it endowed with that.‚Äù

original: de ni yid kyi shes pas so //
analyzed: de ni yid kyi shes pas so //
translated: That is by the mental cognition.

original: snang bar zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: snang bar zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn appearance‚Äù refers to the other.

original: mi slu ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lan no ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //üîΩde'i zhes bya ba ni snang bzhin pa'i rang bzhin la'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lan no ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o // de'i zhes bya ba ni snang bzhin pa'i rang bzhin la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is non-deceptive‚Äù refers to the other‚Äôs reply. ‚ÄúIt is not‚Äù is the refutation.üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the nature that appears.

original: des ni zhes bya ba snang bzhin pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba snang bzhin pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù refers to the nature that appears.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba don bya ba rtogs pa la rang gi ngo bo tsam zhig snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba don bya ba rtogs pa la rang gi ngo bo tsam zhig snang ba yin no //
translated: Thus, in the realization of the object, only the essence of the object appears.

original: rang rig pa las gzhan ni 'di 'dra bar 'gyur bar mi 'os so //
analyzed: rang rig pa las gzhan ni 'di 'dra bar 'gyur bar mi 'os so //
translated: It is not suitable for anything else to appear in this way.

original: 'on te yid shes pa la snang ba de ni shes pa gzhan gyis kyang rig go //
analyzed: 'on te yid shes pa la snang ba de ni shes pa gzhan gyis kyang rig go //
translated: If the appearance in the mental consciousness is cognized by another consciousness,

original: gang zhig dran pa des rtogs pa de nyid ni sngar yang mngon sum gyi yul du byas pa yin pa des na ji ltar rang rig pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig dran pa des rtogs pa de nyid ni sngar yang mngon sum gyi yul du byas pa yin pa des na ji ltar rang rig pa yin zhe na /
translated: then the one who remembers and realizes it would have previously made it the object of direct perception. In that case, how could it be self-awareness?

original: 'gog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not the case that it is not.

original: yid kyi shes pa 'di ni dran pa yin la de yang sngar gyi dus na yod pa'i mthong ba nyid mngon par zhen pa yin na /
analyzed: yid kyi shes pa 'di ni dran pa yin la de yang sngar gyi dus na yod pa'i mthong ba nyid mngon par zhen pa yin na /
translated: This mental consciousness is memory, and that is the manifestation of the seeing that existed in the past.

original: snga ma'i rang bzhin ni yid kyi shes pa la snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma'i rang bzhin ni yid kyi shes pa la snang ba ma yin no //
translated: The essence of the past is not the appearance in the mental consciousness.

original: des na 'di nyid sngar yang rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur 'di yang zhes bya ba da ltar ba'i rang bzhin yang dran pas yul du byed do zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'di nyid sngar yang rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur 'di yang zhes bya ba da ltar ba'i rang bzhin yang dran pas yul du byed do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how could it be that this very [mental consciousness] was realized in the past? Also, the present essence is made the object by memory.

original: 'di 'gog pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation of this is ‚ÄúBut then . . . ‚Äù

original: 'o na yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di ji ltar mi bden pa yin zhe na gzhal bya dang zhes smos so //üîΩblo gzhan gyis zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don brjod pa ni don gyis go ba'am /
analyzed: 'o na yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'di ji ltar mi bden pa yin zhe na gzhal bya dang zhes smos so // blo gzhan gyis zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don brjod pa ni don gyis go ba'am /
translated: But how is this mental consciousness not true? ‚ÄúThe object of one . . . ‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúBy another mind‚Äù is the meaning of this, which is understood by implication.

original: gzhan gyis kyang rung ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang rung ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or it is by another.

original: ji ltar phan tshun gsal bar mi 'thad snyam na blo dag ces smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar phan tshun gsal bar mi 'thad snyam na blo dag ces smos so //
translated: How is it not tenable that they mutually illuminate? ‚ÄúThe minds . . . ‚Äù

original: gsal min bdag tu zhes bya ba ni gsal bar bya ba dang gsal bar byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'i blo dag go //
analyzed: gsal min bdag tu zhes bya ba ni gsal bar bya ba dang gsal bar byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'i blo dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúNot illuminating, the self . . . ‚Äù refers to the minds that are asserted to be that which illuminates and that which is illuminated.

original: gsal bar @322a * //
analyzed: gsal bar @322a * //
translated: Illuminating . . .

original: byed pa'i blo yang gsal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa'i blo yang gsal ba ma yin te /
translated: The mind that illuminates is not illuminated.

original: rang rig par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not accepted that it is reflexive awareness.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'i sgron ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni mi gsal ba'i sgron ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another‚Äù refers to an unclear lamp.

original: de dag las gzhan zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i shes pa las gzhan pa'i don to //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i shes pa las gzhan pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúOther than those‚Äù refers to an object that is other than a clear consciousness.

original: de'ang ni zhes ba'o //
analyzed: de'ang ni zhes ba'o //
translated: That is also . . .

original: 'di ni shes pa'o myong yin zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni shes pa'o myong yin zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is consciousness, this is experience‚Äù is self-awareness.

original: de nyid bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sgron ma nyid bzhin du'o //üîΩde dang chos mtshungs nyid kyis na //
analyzed: de nyid bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sgron ma nyid bzhin du'o // de dang chos mtshungs nyid kyis na //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like that‚Äù means just like the lamp.üîΩ‚ÄúBy the same token‚Äù means by the same reason.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos mtshungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos mtshungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the same token‚Äù means by the same reason.

original: 'di 'dzin na zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa 'dzin na'o //
analyzed: 'di 'dzin na zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa 'dzin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it apprehends itself‚Äù means if consciousness apprehends itself.

original: 'di zhes bya ba don rig pa 'di phyi rol ma yin na de'i tshe ji ltar mar me dang mtshungs pa nyid yin yang phyi rol du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rang rig pa nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba don rig pa 'di phyi rol ma yin na de'i tshe ji ltar mar me dang mtshungs pa nyid yin yang phyi rol du mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rang rig pa nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur /
translated: If this object of awareness is not external, then just as it is similar to the lamp, why is it not self-awareness?

original: 'o na ji ltar mar me dpe yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mar me dpe yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is the lamp an example?

original: de yang zhes gsungs te mar me yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes gsungs te mar me yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the lamp.

original: dper na mar me snang ba gzhan gyis gsal ba ma yin pa de bzhin du shes pa yang yin pa de tsam gyi dpe nyid do //üîΩblo la zhes bya ba ni blo'i blo la'o //
analyzed: dper na mar me snang ba gzhan gyis gsal ba ma yin pa de bzhin du shes pa yang yin pa de tsam gyi dpe nyid do // blo la zhes bya ba ni blo'i blo la'o //
translated: Just as the lamp is illuminated by another light, so too is consciousness. That is the extent of the example.üîΩ‚ÄúIn the mind‚Äù means in the mind of the mind.

original: blo zhes bya ba don gyi blo'o //
analyzed: blo zhes bya ba don gyi blo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMind‚Äù refers to the object of the mind.

original: blo ni zhes bya ba ni don gyi blo'o //
analyzed: blo ni zhes bya ba ni don gyi blo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition‚Äù is the cognition of the object.

original: don gzhan ni don gyi rang bzhin du skyed pa shes pa'i gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan ni don gyi rang bzhin du skyed pa shes pa'i gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother object‚Äù is the object that is produced in the nature of the object.

original: blo gcig ces bya ba ni blo'i blo'o //
analyzed: blo gcig ces bya ba ni blo'i blo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition of the cognition‚Äù is the cognition of the cognition of the object.

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni don gyi blo'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni don gyi blo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù is the cognition of the object.

original: 'o na gsal ba ma yin pa'i don yang ji ltar gsal snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na gsal ba ma yin pa'i don yang ji ltar gsal snyam na /
translated: But how can an object that is not manifest be made manifest?

original: don de'i ngo bos zhes smos te /
analyzed: don de'i ngo bos zhes smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚Äúby the nature of that object.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: By the nature of the cognition.

original: de'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa nyid las gsal bar brjod par zad kyi don dam par ni 'di gsal ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyis shes pa nyid las gsal bar brjod par zad kyi don dam par ni 'di gsal ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is only the cognition that is manifest, and it is said that the object is manifest because it has the same nature as the cognition. But in reality, the object is not manifest.

original: 'o na ji ltar de gsal ba nyid du tha snyad byed snyam na de bzhin du zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de gsal ba nyid du tha snyad byed snyam na de bzhin du zhes smos so //
translated: But how can it be conventionally said that the object is manifest? The text says, ‚Äúin the same way.‚Äù

original: bum pa sngar yang yod pa yin la phyis kyang yod par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa sngar yang yod pa yin la phyis kyang yod par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: The pot existed before and it exists later. This is the concomitance.

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin ni sngar dang phyis med kyi 'on kyang de'i tshe yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin ni sngar dang phyis med kyi 'on kyang de'i tshe yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'o //
translated: The nature of manifestation is not prior to or subsequent to the manifestation itself, but it exists at the time of manifestation.

original: 'on te mthong ba nyid kyi tha snyad las mig mngon du phyogs so zhes nges so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mthong ba nyid kyi tha snyad las mig mngon du phyogs so zhes nges so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the eye is directed toward the object because of the convention of seeing,

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de la yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de la yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: we reply: In that case,

original: mig mngon du phyogs pa nyid la yang ngo //
analyzed: mig mngon du phyogs pa nyid la yang ngo //
translated: the eye is directed toward the object,

original: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni myong bar gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni myong bar gyur pa nyid do //
translated: and the object is in that condition, that is, in the condition of being experienced.

original: 'on te sngar brjod pa ni yi ge'i phyi mo gang yin pa de nyid dang lhan cig de'i tshe'i yi ge phyi mo gcig nyid du 'dzin pa yin pa des na ring po nyid rigs so zhe na 'di la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te sngar brjod pa ni yi ge'i phyi mo gang yin pa de nyid dang lhan cig de'i tshe'i yi ge phyi mo gcig nyid du 'dzin pa yin pa des na ring po nyid rigs so zhe na 'di la brjod pa ni /
translated: But if you say that the letter is long because the letter that was previously pronounced is apprehended together with the letter that is being pronounced at the present time,üîΩwe reply:

original: mi @322b gnas bzhi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi @322b gnas bzhi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In that case, the letter would be long because of the four non-abiding.

original: 'on te phyi mo re re 'dzin pa nyid 'di 'dzin par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te phyi mo re re 'dzin pa nyid 'di 'dzin par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the letter is long because each letter is apprehended as it is pronounced,

original: phyi mo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: phyi mo zhes gsungs te /
translated: we reply:

original: thung du yang ring bo nyid du 'dzin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thung du yang ring bo nyid du 'dzin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that a short one would be apprehended as a long one.

original: 'on te phyi ma rnams kyi tshogs rtogs par na ring por rtogs pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te phyi ma rnams kyi tshogs rtogs par na ring por rtogs pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that a long one is apprehended because of the collection of the latter ones,

original: chogs pa zhes smos so de yang zhes bya ba ni bsdoms pa'o //
analyzed: chogs pa zhes smos so de yang zhes bya ba ni bsdoms pa'o //
translated: the word ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is mentioned. ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the sum total.

original: rang rig pa med par ni snga ma dang phyi ma rtogs pa ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: rang rig pa med par ni snga ma dang phyi ma rtogs pa ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that without reflexive awareness, the former and latter are not apprehended.

original: ring po zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ring po zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLong‚Äù is the opinion.

original: rtogs mod kyi zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: rtogs mod kyi zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: don tsam rtogs so zhes ni 'dod pa'i kho na'o //
analyzed: don tsam rtogs so zhes ni 'dod pa'i kho na'o //
translated: It is only asserted that the mere object is apprehended.

original: 'on kyang khyad par yod do zhes bya bar ston pa ni 'on kyang zhes bya pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par yod do zhes bya bar ston pa ni 'on kyang zhes bya pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHowever‚Äù indicates that there is a difference.

original: gang gis na sangs rgyas pa'i'o //
analyzed: gang gis na sangs rgyas pa'i'o //
translated: By what? By the Buddhist.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement here is ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: blo gcig pa nyid kyang rigs mi mthun pa'i blos par mchod pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: blo gcig pa nyid kyang rigs mi mthun pa'i blos par mchod pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The fact that there is a single cognition should be understood from the refutation of a cognition that is of a different type.

original: gnas skabs 'di gnyis zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyis rig pa la'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di gnyis zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyis rig pa la'o //
translated: The two occasions are known by oneself and others.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po blo yang gzhan gyis rig par bya ba nyid du sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol po blo yang gzhan gyis rig par bya ba nyid du sgrub par byed do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin this way‚Äù and so on proves that the cognition of others is also to be known by another cognition.

original: phyi mo rnams ni mi gnas pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi mo rnams ni mi gnas pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The prior cognitions are not non-abiding.

original: 'on kyang gnas pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gnas pa kho na yin te /
translated: On the contrary, they are abiding.

original: de'i phyir ring po la sogs pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ring po la sogs pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, they apprehend long and so on.

original: yul tha dad na blo yang tha dad do zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan yang bzlog par rtogs pa med pa kho na'o zhes ston pa ni de skad du yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yul tha dad na blo yang tha dad do zhes bya ba 'di la gzhan yang bzlog par rtogs pa med pa kho na'o zhes ston pa ni de skad du yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position that if the object is different, the cognition is also different is completely unestablished.

original: gal te 'dis ni pha rol pos blo rtogs pa tsam brjod kyi tha dad pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dis ni pha rol pos blo rtogs pa tsam brjod kyi tha dad pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the opponent says that this merely expresses the cognition of the other, but it is not different, then the response is ‚ÄúHow is that?‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhes gsungs te zhes bya ba ni blo'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes gsungs te zhes bya ba ni blo'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the cognition.

original: rnam 'grel bshad pa'i don du re zhig rang nyid brjod pa ni gal te 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel bshad pa'i don du re zhig rang nyid brjod pa ni gal te 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to explain the meaning of the commentary, he first states, ‚ÄúIf this is said.‚Äù

original: gcig nyid do zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni snga ma ldog pa'i phyir dang phyi ma 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid do zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni snga ma ldog pa'i phyir dang phyi ma 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It would not be said that it is one, because the former has ceased and the latter has arisen.

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni 'di ring po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni 'di ring po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The latter half is explained: ‚ÄúIt is long.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe ni zhes bya ba tha ma'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni zhes bya ba tha ma'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: At that time, at the final moment.

original: rim pa med pa zhes bya ba ni cha thams cad de'i tshe nyid nye bar gnas pa'i phyir 'dzin pa yang rim pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rim pa med pa zhes bya ba ni cha thams cad de'i tshe nyid nye bar gnas pa'i phyir 'dzin pa yang rim pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Without order, because all parts exist at that time, the apprehension also is without order.

original: gal te yul yang gnas pa ma yin nam de ji ltar yul mi gnas pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa yin snyam na ma 'phel pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te yul yang gnas pa ma yin nam de ji ltar yul mi gnas pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa yin snyam na ma 'phel pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: If you think that since the object also does not endure, how can it be said that the object does not endure because it is not apprehended, he says, ‚Äúwithout increase.‚Äù

original: de lta yin no zhes na zhes bya ba ni ma 'phel ba nyid 'phel ba gzhan yang khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: de lta yin no zhes na zhes bya ba ni ma 'phel ba nyid 'phel ba gzhan yang khas blangs dgos so //
translated: If that is so, he says, ‚Äúthen,‚Äù you must accept that the non-increase itself increases.

original: yang 'phel ba gzhan du yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang 'phel ba gzhan du yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if it increases again, there is no difference.

original: de lta na yang thug pa med pa yin te de nyid kyis zhes bya ba @323a * //
analyzed: de lta na yang thug pa med pa yin te de nyid kyis zhes bya ba @323a * //
translated: Even so, there is an infinite regress, because it is the same.

original: ni rtsol bas so //
analyzed: ni rtsol bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy effort‚Äù means by exertion.

original: de zhes bya ba rang bzhin snga ma las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba rang bzhin snga ma las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the prior nature, because it is not different.

original: gzhan ni rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni rtsol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù refers to exertion.

original: blo tha ma zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir nyams su ma myong ngan dran par mi 'gyur la blo snga ma rnams kyang nyams su myong ba ma yin pa des na de dag ni dran pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang tha ma gcig pu dran par 'gyur
analyzed: blo tha ma zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir nyams su ma myong ngan dran par mi 'gyur la blo snga ma rnams kyang nyams su myong ba ma yin pa des na de dag ni dran pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang tha ma gcig pu dran par 'gyur
translated: ‚ÄúThe final cognition‚Äù means that because it is not experienced, it is not remembered, and because the prior cognitions are not experienced, they are not remembered. Therefore, they are not remembered. However, the final one is remembered.

original: ro // 'di nyid gsal 'debs pa ni blo snga ma dag ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ro // 'di nyid gsal 'debs pa ni blo snga ma dag ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is clarified by ‚ÄúThe prior cognitions,‚Äù etc.

original: ring po'i cha snga ma 'dzin par byed pa dag go //
analyzed: ring po'i cha snga ma 'dzin par byed pa dag go //
translated: They are the ones that apprehend the prior part of the long sound.

original: 'on te tha ma nyid kyis ring po 'dzin la de la yang myong ba yod pa des na ring po blo dran par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te tha ma nyid kyis ring po 'dzin la de la yang myong ba yod pa des na ring po blo dran par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the final cognition alone apprehends the long sound, and it is experienced, then the long sound would be remembered by the cognition.

original: tha ma yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tha ma yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe final cognition‚Äù is stated.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ring po'i cha snga ma dang phyi ma 'dzin pa'i blo thams cad nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ring po'i cha snga ma dang phyi ma 'dzin pa'i blo thams cad nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because all the cognitions that apprehend the prior and final parts of the long sound are not experienced.

original: de ni gzhan la'ang zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang de skad ces dper na sgra'i cha 'dzin pa'i blo rnams myur bar 'jug pa'i rgyu las sbyor bar byed kyi brjod pa de bzhin du yi ge'i cha 'dzin pa'i blo'i blo yi ge'i blo med pa'i rang bzhin rnams
analyzed: de ni gzhan la'ang zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang de skad ces dper na sgra'i cha 'dzin pa'i blo rnams myur bar 'jug pa'i rgyu las sbyor bar byed kyi brjod pa de bzhin du yi ge'i cha 'dzin pa'i blo'i blo yi ge'i blo med pa'i rang bzhin rnams
translated: And also for others. Here, just as the cause of the rapid engagement of the cognition apprehending the part of sound is applied, so too the cause of the rapid engagement of the cognition apprehending the part of the letter is applied.

original: myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir na yi ge rtog pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes brjod par nus so //
analyzed: myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir na yi ge rtog pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes brjod par nus so //
translated: Thus, it is possible to say that the cognition of the letter is just the conception of the letter, because it is rapid.

original: re zhig gnas pa'i phyogs brjod pa ni thung du gnyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig gnas pa'i phyogs brjod pa ni thung du gnyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The position of abiding is stated: ‚ÄúTwo short ones.‚Äù

original: gcig pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni 'di ni yi ge'i bdag nyid gcig yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi blo'o //
analyzed: gcig pa'i blo zhes bya ba ni 'di ni yi ge'i bdag nyid gcig yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi blo'o //
translated: The cognition of oneness is the cognition that has the form ‚ÄúThis is one letter.‚ÄùüîΩWith regard to the long ones, etc., the parts that have the nature of the parts of the long ones, etc.

original: phyi mo rnams la zhes bya ba ni yi ge ring po la sogs pa'i cha shas kyi rang bzhin rnams la'o zhes bya ba ni thung du gnyis la yod pa'i rnam par 'chad pa gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: phyi mo rnams la zhes bya ba ni yi ge ring po la sogs pa'i cha shas kyi rang bzhin rnams la'o zhes bya ba ni thung du gnyis la yod pa'i rnam par 'chad pa gang yin pa de'o //
translated: The analysis that exists for two short ones.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba rnam par chad pa yod kyang ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba rnam par chad pa yod kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though‚Äù means even though there is a break.

original: 'on te ji ltar thung du gnyis brjod pa la rnam par chad pa yod pa de bzhin du ring po la sogs pa brjod pa la yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar thung du gnyis brjod pa la rnam par chad pa yod pa de bzhin du ring po la sogs pa brjod pa la yang yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that just as there is a break in the utterance of two short vowels, so there is also a break in the utterance of long vowels, etc.,

original: 'dir ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the verse says ‚Äúhere.‚Äù

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par chad pa nyid du snang ba zhes bya ba 'di'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par chad pa nyid du snang ba zhes bya ba 'di'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù means ‚Äúin the case of the utterance of long vowels, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te ma mthong pa'i phyir blo cig car mi skyed par sgrub par byed na de'i tshe mi dmigs pa tshad mar khas blangs bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te ma mthong pa'i phyir blo cig car mi skyed par sgrub par byed na de'i tshe mi dmigs pa tshad mar khas blangs bar bya ba yin no //
translated: If you prove that the cognition does not arise simultaneously because it is not seen, then you must accept that non-apprehension is a valid cognition.

original: de'i tshe yang yi ge cha rnam par chad par snang ba med pa kho na ste ma mthong ba'i tshad ma ni rnam par ma chad pa de la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang yi ge cha rnam par chad par snang ba med pa kho na ste ma mthong ba'i tshad ma ni rnam par ma chad pa de la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But in that case, the appearance of the parts of the letters would not be broken up at all, because the valid cognition that does not see it would also exist in the unbroken [appearance].

original: des ma mthong ba'i tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par chad pa med par nges nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des ma mthong ba'i tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par chad pa med par nges nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not a valid cognition that does not see it, it cannot ascertain the absence of a break.

original: ring po la sogs pa brjod pa'i dus su rigs pa can la sogs pas 'dod pa'i rnam par chad pa'i blo skye ba med pa gang yin med par sgrub par byed pa @323b ma yin pa'i mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sangs rgyas pa 'dod pa'i
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa brjod pa'i dus su rigs pa can la sogs pas 'dod pa'i rnam par chad pa'i blo skye ba med pa gang yin med par sgrub par byed pa @323b ma yin pa'i mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid sangs rgyas pa 'dod pa'i
translated: When the word long is uttered, the awareness that is the object of the word long is not produced in the way that the logicians assert, and the non-observation that is not a proof of nonexistence is the proof of nonexistence for the Buddhists.

original: cig car ba med pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin nam ci khyed la ni sangs rgyas pa la'o //üîΩgnas pa ma yin zhing zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyi don ni go skabs med do zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩdon la sbyor ba na mig la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //üîΩji ltar dus gcig bu bum pa gcig gi yul can gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa gnyis mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: cig car ba med pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin nam ci khyed la ni sangs rgyas pa la'o // gnas pa ma yin zhing zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyi don ni go skabs med do zhes bya ba yin no // don la sbyor ba na mig la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o // ji ltar dus gcig bu bum pa gcig gi yul can gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa gnyis mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: Is that not the proof of nonexistence for the Buddhists?

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i zhes bya ba la sgra 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni gzung ba yin la de'i yul can ni 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i zhes bya ba la sgra 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni gzung ba yin la de'i yul can ni 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is not tenable that it is

original: de ltar na re zhig rnam par rtog pa la gsal bar snang ba nyid med do zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rnam par rtog pa la gsal bar snang ba nyid med do zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that the manifestation of the object is not clear.

original: da ni khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: da ni khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa ni /
translated: Now, having accepted that, it is said:

original: gsal bar snang ba yin na yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgang gis gnod ces grub pa'i mtha' pas dris pa na /
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba yin na yang zhes bya ba'o // gang gis gnod ces grub pa'i mtha' pas dris pa na /
translated: Even if there is a clear manifestation,

original: pha rol po lan 'debs pa ni bar du chod pas so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol po lan 'debs pa ni bar du chod pas so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent replies: ‚ÄúBecause there is an obstruction.‚Äù

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni de su na 'byin pa ste ring po la sogs pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni de su na 'byin pa ste ring po la sogs pa brjod pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúthis‚Äù refers to the object, and ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the sense faculty.

original: sngon myong bar gyur pa dang ltar myong bzhin pa gcig nyid gang yin pa de ltar 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon myong bar gyur pa dang ltar myong bzhin pa gcig nyid gang yin pa de ltar 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the cognition is to apprehend that which is experienced in the past and that which is being experienced in the present as being the same.

original: 'on te da ltar dran pas spyod yul du byas pa gang yin pa de nyid mngon sum gyis kyang 'dzin pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te da ltar dran pas spyod yul du byas pa gang yin pa de nyid mngon sum gyis kyang 'dzin pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that what is made the object of memory in the present is apprehended by direct perception as well,

original: dran pa'i yul gyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dran pa'i yul gyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: then it is said that ‚Äúthe object of memory‚Äù is the object of direct perception.

original: ngo shes pa ni mngon sum gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni mngon sum gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: Because recognition has the nature of direct perception, it is suitable to exist in a suitable object.

original: sngon mthong ba'i rang bzhin ni rung ba'i yul na gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon mthong ba'i rang bzhin ni rung ba'i yul na gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: But the nature of what was seen previously does not exist in a suitable object.üîΩTherefore, since recognition that apprehends the nature of what exists in a suitable object does not apprehend that, how could it apprehend the nature of what is prior and subsequent?

original: des na rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i ngo shes pas ni de 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ci ltar snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa yin zhes ston par byed pa ni gal te de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: des na rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i ngo shes pas ni de 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ci ltar snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa yin zhes ston par byed pa ni gal te de lta na zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúIf that is so, then memory would not exist.‚Äù

original: pa'o // dran pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: pa'o // dran pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Memory is that which thinks, ‚ÄúThat is this.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi dran pa med par ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi dran pa med par ro //
translated: Without memory that has such an aspect,üîΩwhy does direct perception not understand that it is one?

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid du mngon sum gyis ci ste mi rtogs 'di la pha rol pos brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid du mngon sum gyis ci ste mi rtogs 'di la pha rol pos brjod pa ni /
translated: The opponent says this:

original: de dang zhes bya ba ste sngar gyi yul dang lhan cig 'brel pa gang yin pa de dang bral ba'i phyir de ltar mi rtogs so 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ste sngar gyi yul dang lhan cig 'brel pa gang yin pa de dang bral ba'i phyir de ltar mi rtogs so 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the object that was previously related to the cognition. Since it is separated from that, it is not cognized. ‚ÄúBut‚Äù is the response.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy which‚Äù means by direct perception or inference.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa tsam tshad mar khas len na'o //üîΩ'on te sngar gyi dus la @324a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa tsam tshad mar khas len na'o // 'on te sngar gyi dus la @324a * //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means if one accepts mere cognition as valid knowledge.üîΩ‚ÄúIf it is not like that‚Äù means if the object is not related to the past and so on.

original: sogs pa dang 'brel pa ma rtogs med do //
analyzed: sogs pa dang 'brel pa ma rtogs med do //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no non-cognition of the relation‚Äù means there is no non-cognition of the relation to the past and so on.

original: re zhig 'brel pa can ni rtogs pa yin no snyam na gal te sngon gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig 'brel pa can ni rtogs pa yin no snyam na gal te sngon gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one thinks the related object is cognized, then if it is the past, it is not cognized.

original: 'on te da lta nyid du skyes pa ni sngar nyid yod pa ma yin pas na ji ltar brtag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te da lta nyid du skyes pa ni sngar nyid yod pa ma yin pas na ji ltar brtag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is the present, it does not exist before, so how can it be cognized?

original: gal te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one says ‚Äúbut,‚ÄùüîΩthen when asked by another, ‚ÄúHow does the present exist if it did not arise before?‚Äù

original: da ltar ba de sngar ma skyes pa ci ltar yod ces gzhan gyis dris pa la sngar zhig pa'i bum pa la sogs pa yang ji ltar yod de /
analyzed: da ltar ba de sngar ma skyes pa ci ltar yod ces gzhan gyis dris pa la sngar zhig pa'i bum pa la sogs pa yang ji ltar yod de /
translated: ‚ÄúThe past destroyed pot and so on, how do they exist?‚Äù

original: de yang brtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang brtag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That also is not a proper analysis.

original: pha rol po khyad par ston pa ni khyad par 'di zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: pha rol po khyad par ston pa ni khyad par 'di zhes gsungs te /
translated: The opponent teaches a distinction, saying, ‚ÄúThis distinction . . .‚Äù

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni dran pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni dran pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that that which will arise is not memory.

original: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la grub pa'i mtha' pas gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here, the one of the school says,

original: sngar zhes gsungs so //üîΩpha rol gyis smras pa ni 'byung ba nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngar zhes gsungs so // pha rol gyis smras pa ni 'byung ba nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPreviously . . .‚ÄùüîΩThe opponent says, ‚ÄúIt is arising . . .‚Äù

original: 'di la lan ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúThat which will arise . . .‚Äù

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni zhig pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni zhig pa la yang ngo //
translated: Here, ‚Äúalso‚Äù means also in the case of cessation.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni dbus su zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni dbus su zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the response is, ‚ÄúIn the middle . . .‚Äù

original: re zhig gang gi tshe rtogs pa de'i tshe yod /
analyzed: re zhig gang gi tshe rtogs pa de'i tshe yod /
translated: When it is realized, at that time it exists.

original: med par na yod do zhes bya bar go ji ltar 'gyur te bar du ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par na yod do zhes bya bar go ji ltar 'gyur te bar du ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it does not exist, how could it be understood that it exists, because it is not realized in the middle?

original: pha rol pos da ltar zhes smras so //
analyzed: pha rol pos da ltar zhes smras so //
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúNow . . .‚Äù

original: da ltar mthong bas dbus su yod par ji ltar zhe na sngar zhes smras so //
analyzed: da ltar mthong bas dbus su yod par ji ltar zhe na sngar zhes smras so //
translated: How could it be said that it exists in the middle, because it is seen now?

original: lan ni 'o na zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lan ni 'o na zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúWell then . . .‚Äù

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pas sngar yod pa nyid du rtogs so zhe na ;
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pas sngar yod pa nyid du rtogs so zhe na ;
translated: But it is understood that it existed previously through inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang zhes smras so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang zhes smras so //
translated: Inference is also said to be non-apprehension.

original: bar med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ni sngar zhes gnas pa nyid mthong ba yin gyi dngos po gzhan mthong bas bar chod pa ni ma yin pa de la'o //
analyzed: bar med pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ni sngar zhes gnas pa nyid mthong ba yin gyi dngos po gzhan mthong bas bar chod pa ni ma yin pa de la'o //
translated: Without interval means that it is seen to have existed previously, not that it is seen as another entity, interrupted by something else.

original: sun 'byin pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not a refutation.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni nga'i mthong ba'i rgyun ma chad do zhes bya ba'i dran pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni nga'i mthong ba'i rgyun ma chad do zhes bya ba'i dran pa nyid do //
translated: That itself means memory, which is the unbroken continuity of my seeing.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sngar gnas pa nyid kyis ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sngar gnas pa nyid kyis ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: By that itself means not by its previous existence.

original: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gal te de nyid kyis byed na'o //üîΩde nyid ces bya ba ni sngar gnas pa nyid do //üîΩde nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni sngar gnas pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gal te de nyid kyis byed na'o // de nyid ces bya ba ni sngar gnas pa nyid do // de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni sngar gnas pa nyid du'o //
translated: If it were not so means if it were to be produced by that itself.üîΩThat itself means its previous existence.üîΩAt that time means previously.

original: de nyid la ni sngar gnas pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: de nyid la ni sngar gnas pa nyid la'o //
translated: In that itself means in its previous existence.

original: thug pa med pa nyid ston pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thug pa med pa nyid ston pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration of the non-recursiveness is ‚Äúbecause . . . ‚Äù

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni de nyid don bya ba ni yin no zhes bya ba de la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni de nyid don bya ba ni yin no zhes bya ba de la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd in that‚Äù refers to ‚Äúthat very object is the function.‚Äù

original: bar bcad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni blo'i blos so //
analyzed: bar bcad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni blo'i blos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to avoid‚Äù means in order to avoid the fault of the cognition of cognition.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcig gi tshe nyid phyi ma la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang 'dzin par yang 'gyur ba @324b yin te /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gcig gi tshe nyid phyi ma la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang 'dzin par yang 'gyur ba @324b yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúOr else . . . ‚Äù and so on means that at the time of one cognition, the subsequent cognition and so on would be apprehended and would also be apprehended by that.

original: des na phyi mo 'dzin pa thams cad dus mtshungs pa kho nar de 'dzin pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir blo yun ring po dran pa 'thad pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi zhe rtsis so //
analyzed: des na phyi mo 'dzin pa thams cad dus mtshungs pa kho nar de 'dzin pas nyams su myong ba'i phyir blo yun ring po dran pa 'thad pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi zhe rtsis so //
translated: Therefore, since all prior cognitions are experienced by the subsequent cognition that apprehends them, it is only tenable that the mind remembers for a long time. This is the opponent‚Äôs reasoning.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni de yang mi 'thad de bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni de yang mi 'thad de bya ba'o //
translated: Here we say: That is also untenable.

original: don de dang shes pa gnyis kyis myong ba gang yin pa de dag go //
analyzed: don de dang shes pa gnyis kyis myong ba gang yin pa de dag go //
translated: Those are the experiences of both the object and the cognition.

original: yang ji ltar na shes pa cig car 'byung ba mi 'dod snyam na shes pa cig car zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang ji ltar na shes pa cig car 'byung ba mi 'dod snyam na shes pa cig car zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Again, how is it that you do not accept that consciousnesses occur simultaneously?

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni don snang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni don snang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second half of the verse explains this: ‚ÄúThe appearance of objects is not simultaneous.‚Äù

original: 'o na ci ltar rtogs snyam na rang gis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar rtogs snyam na rang gis zhes gsungs so //
translated: How then is it understood? ‚ÄúBy itself.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'i dpe nyid mi 'grig par ston pa ni gal te bde ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'i dpe nyid mi 'grig par ston pa ni gal te bde ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example given by the opponent is not appropriate. If you say, ‚ÄúPleasure,‚Äù

original: de'i blo yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i blo yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i blo yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i blo yang ngo //
translated: the cognition of that, that is, the cognition of pleasure, etc.

original: tha dad par yang ci ste mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad par yang ci ste mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it not different?

original: tha dad par snang ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tha dad par snang ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: It appears different.

original: 'o na bde ba rigs pa ci ltar gzhag par rigs she na /
analyzed: 'o na bde ba rigs pa ci ltar gzhag par rigs she na /
translated: How then is it appropriate to posit pleasure as a type?

original: bde ba myong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba myong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe experience of pleasure.‚Äù

original: don la yang de kho na ltar rigs so zhes ston pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni yang myong ngo zhes rigs so ;
analyzed: don la yang de kho na ltar rigs so zhes ston pa ni de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni yang myong ngo zhes rigs so ;
translated: It is also appropriate to apply that to objects. The text shows this: ‚ÄúIn the same way, the experience of blue, etc.‚Äù

original: /'di na zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: /'di na zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù means in blue, etc.

original: snang ba gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: snang ba gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: It is not at all different from the appearance of form and so on.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na gsal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na gsal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When? When it is clear.

original: don la brjod pa ni rig pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don la brjod pa ni rig pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is stated in the words ‚Äúawareness‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i tshe rig pa dang sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa de ltar brtag pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i tshe rig pa dang sngon po la sogs pa tha dad pa de ltar brtag pa yin na /
translated: At that time, if awareness and blue and so on are different, then it would be like this.

original: de lta yang zhes bya ba rig pa dang sngon po la sogs pa tha dad par mtshon pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yang zhes bya ba rig pa dang sngon po la sogs pa tha dad par mtshon pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not like that. Awareness and blue and so on are not different.

original: 'ba' zhig ni gzugs dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ni gzugs dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Alone‚Äù means free from form.

original: gzugs dang snang ba dang bral bar byis pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang snang ba dang bral bar byis pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Some, such as the childish, apprehend it as free from form and appearance.

original: de bzhin du rim gyis pa la yang don dang don snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rim gyis pa la yang don dang don snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: In the same way, the gradualist should also apply the words ‚Äúobject‚Äù and ‚Äúappearance of the object‚Äù and so on.

original: nyes pa de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //üîΩre zhig dang po ni don rig par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o // re zhig dang po ni don rig par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The same fault is shown by the words ‚Äúin the same way.‚ÄùüîΩFirst, the object is cognized.

original: de nas ni don snang ba'i shes pa rig go //
analyzed: de nas ni don snang ba'i shes pa rig go //
translated: Then the cognition of the appearance of the object is cognized.

original: 'on te don rig pa rig pa'i dus na don du snang ba mi rig pa ste don rig pa tsam rig pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te don rig pa rig pa'i dus na don du snang ba mi rig pa ste don rig pa tsam rig pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that when consciousness is aware of an object, it is not aware of the appearance as object, because it is aware of the object alone,

original: don rig pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don rig pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: then it is said that it is aware of the object.

original: dag pa'i don du snang ba dang bral lo //
analyzed: dag pa'i don du snang ba dang bral lo //
translated: It is free from the appearance of the object as pure.

original: des na don rig pa rig yin na /
analyzed: des na don rig pa rig yin na /
translated: Therefore, if it is aware of the object,

original: nges par dus su snang ba rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par dus su snang ba rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: it must be aware of the appearance at the time of the object.

original: des na don gyi rnam pa lan gnyis su snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na don gyi rnam pa lan gnyis su snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the aspect of the object would appear twice.üîΩIf it were not so,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te don du snang ba ma rig na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te don du snang ba ma rig na'o //
translated: if the appearance as object were not known,

original: rnam 'grel 'di ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don bshad pa'i don du sum 'byin par byed pas smras pa @325a * //
analyzed: rnam 'grel 'di ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don bshad pa'i don du sum 'byin par byed pas smras pa @325a * //
translated: this commentary is stated in order to explain the intended meaning of the Abhidharma.

original: ni 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ni 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here means in this text.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rig pa 'dzin pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rig pa 'dzin pa la yang ngo //
translated: Also means also in the case of the awareness of pleasure and so on.üîΩIn this context means

original: skabs nyid la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skabs nyid la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: in the context of the following passage:

original: dran pa las kyang bdag rig grub //üîΩces bya ba 'di la'o //
analyzed: dran pa las kyang bdag rig grub //üîΩces bya ba 'di la'o //
translated: The self is also known from memory.

original: 'pho bar mi 'gyur ba nyid sgrub par byed pa ni phyi ma phyi mas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'pho bar mi 'gyur ba nyid sgrub par byed pa ni phyi ma phyi mas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The subsequent cognition establishes the non-transference of the former cognition.

original: gegs byed pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa snga ma shes pa phyi mas myong ba la'o //
analyzed: gegs byed pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa snga ma shes pa phyi mas myong ba la'o //
translated: The obstruction is in the experience of the former cognition by the subsequent cognition.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni blo phyi ma la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni blo phyi ma la'o //
translated: The subsequent cognition is the one that is subsequent to the former cognition.

original: phyi'i gegs byed pa med pa na blo snga ma phyi mas myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi'i gegs byed pa med pa na blo snga ma phyi mas myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is no obstruction by the external, the former cognition is experienced by the subsequent cognition.

original: don gyis go bas zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i don gzhan du mi 'thad pas so //
analyzed: don gyis go bas zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bar gyur pa'i don gzhan du mi 'thad pas so //
translated: By implication is because the experience of the object is not tenable as something else.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pas zhes bya ba ni par chad med par ro //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pas zhes bya ba ni par chad med par ro //
translated: Without interruption is without a break.

original: de'i tshe yang so sor don nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan rnams la don gyis go ba ci zhig yod des na blo'i skad cig de mtha' dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang so sor don nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan rnams la don gyis go ba ci zhig yod des na blo'i skad cig de mtha' dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, what is the implication for the others that have the characteristic of experiencing the object? Therefore, all those moments of cognition are experienced.

original: de lta yin dang dus de srid bdag gis mthong ngo zhes dran par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dus de srid bdag gis mthong ngo zhes dran par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, one would not remember, I saw for that long.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni don gyis go 'dren pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni don gyis go 'dren pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other refutation is called the ‚Äúinference of the meaning.‚Äù

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bar ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot otherwise‚Äù means not by experience.

original: des na don gyi blo nyams su myong ba ma gags byas pa'i phyir blo nyams su mi myong zhing dran par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skabs nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: des na don gyi blo nyams su myong ba ma gags byas pa'i phyir blo nyams su mi myong zhing dran par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skabs nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: Therefore, since the experience of the meaning is blocked, the experience and memory of the cognition are also blocked. This is the summary of the topic.

original: nyi ste nyams su myong ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur pas ci bya ste /
analyzed: nyi ste nyams su myong ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur pas ci bya ste /
translated: What is the use of the experience of the experience?

original: don yod pa tsam gyis myong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don yod pa tsam gyis myong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: It is the mere existence of the object that is experienced.

original: yod pa tsam las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yod pa tsam las zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom mere existence‚Äù is stated.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: Another says:

original: dbang po dang 'brel pa las don nyams su myong bar 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: dbang po dang 'brel pa las don nyams su myong bar 'gyur gyi //
translated: The object is experienced from the connection with the sense faculty,

original: myong ba nyams su myong ba las ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: myong ba nyams su myong ba las ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: not from the experience of the experience.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni dbang po dang 'brel pa de yang tshad ma gang las rtogs par bya ;
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni dbang po dang 'brel pa de yang tshad ma gang las rtogs par bya ;
translated: Here it is said: That connection with the sense faculty is also understood from what valid cognition?

original: dal yang zhes bya ba 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: dal yang zhes bya ba 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven when at leisure‚Äù means also when there is no discursive thought about the past, etc.

original: des zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus gzhan gyi bdag nyid can gyis so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus gzhan gyi bdag nyid can gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy it‚Äù means by the self which has another object and another time.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba de 'dra ba'i don gyis phyogs pa'i phyir te khyer pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba de 'dra ba'i don gyis phyogs pa'i phyir te khyer pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that alone‚Äù means by the meaning which is directed by that, which is carried by that.

original: 'di nyi gzhung 'dzugs pa dbang po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyi gzhung 'dzugs pa dbang po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the establishment of the text: ‚ÄúThe sense-organ, etc.‚Äù

original: res 'ga' zhes bya ba ni don nye ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' zhes bya ba ni don nye ba'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSometimes‚Äù means when the object is near.

original: res 'ga' ni zhes bya ba don mi nye ba na'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni zhes bya ba don mi nye ba na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSometimes not‚Äù means when the object is not near.

original: de lta ma yin par zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad par ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means when there is an interruption.

original: 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi 'thad kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni khas blangs nas brjod par zad kyi 'thad kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: This is said by way of an assumption, not by way of a proof,

original: don nye bar ma yin pa'i gnas skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don nye bar ma yin pa'i gnas skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no occasion when the object is not near.

original: don gzhan la chags pas te 'chal pas nus pa @325b nyams kyang ngo //
analyzed: don gzhan la chags pas te 'chal pas nus pa @325b nyams kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the loss of capacity due to the attachment to another object‚Äù means by the loss of capacity due to the fault of attachment to another object.

original: gcig shes zhes bya ba ni thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gcig shes zhes bya ba ni thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúKnowing one‚Äù means without obstruction.

original: de'i phyir blo snga ma nus pa med pa'i phyir phyis don gyi blor mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo snga ma nus pa med pa'i phyir phyis don gyi blor mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because the former cognition is powerless, the subsequent cognition of the object does not occur.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad de'i dbang po'i shes pa lnga po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad de'i dbang po'i shes pa lnga po gang yin pa'o //
translated: All the active consciousnesses are the five sense consciousnesses that are its sense faculties.

original: 'on te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma yang rgyu yin la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang yin pa'i phyir nyes pa ci yod snyam na 'jug pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma yang rgyu yin la kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang yin pa'i phyir nyes pa ci yod snyam na 'jug pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if you think that the former active consciousness is the cause and the foundation consciousness is the cause, what is the problem?

original: gal te kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid rgyu yin na ni de'i tshe dus phyis kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma nyid skye bar 'gyur na de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid rgyu yin na ni de'i tshe dus phyis kyang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa snga ma nyid skye bar 'gyur na de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: If the foundation consciousness itself is the cause, then later on, the former active consciousness would arise again, but that is not the case.

original: des na snga ma dang rigs mthun shin tu gsal pa gcig nyid 'byung ba las ni rigs mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa las snga ma nyid de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: des na snga ma dang rigs mthun shin tu gsal pa gcig nyid 'byung ba las ni rigs mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa las snga ma nyid de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the immediately preceding condition of the former consciousness of the same type that is very clear and arises from it.

original: bdag cag gis ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa khas ma blangs te /
analyzed: bdag cag gis ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa khas ma blangs te /
translated: We do not accept the foundation consciousness.

original: nyes ba 'di ni gang gis khas blangs pa de nyid la 'gyur ro zhes thugs la bzhag nas re zhig zhog cig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: nyes ba 'di ni gang gis khas blangs pa de nyid la 'gyur ro zhes thugs la bzhag nas re zhig zhog cig ces gsungs so //
translated: This fault applies to those who do accept it.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the immediately preceding condition.

original: 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni shes pa phyi ma mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni shes pa phyi ma mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNothing would exist‚Äù means that a subsequent consciousness would not occur.

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni kun du chags pa dang ldan pa'o //üîΩde la yang zhes bya ba ni yid la'o //
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni kun du chags pa dang ldan pa'o // de la yang zhes bya ba ni yid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAttachment‚Äù means being endowed with attachment.üîΩ‚ÄúTo that‚Äù means to the mental faculty.

original: de yang ni yid kyi dbang po'i yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang ni yid kyi dbang po'i yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the mental faculty.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni cig car mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni cig car mi skye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means that they do not arise simultaneously.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma gzhan chags pa gang yin pa de nus pa nyams pa nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir ji ltar yid 'grub /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma gzhan chags pa gang yin pa de nus pa nyams pa nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir ji ltar yid 'grub /
